Reviews.Title: “Prime Maui Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nick911
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Napili Shores Resort. Booked directly from the hotel, no issues with check-in. Staff were friendly and courteous. The room: we stayed in unit 164, an upgraded unit with ocean views from the main level patio. Room was generally in good shape except for a few things, and was well situated close to the second or lower tiered pool, giving me that all-important direct ocean view from the patio area. Otherwise, the room was pretty unremarkable. No wireless in the room, however, the internet cable was long enough to reach our laptop on the patio. Our room had a queen bed in the bedroom, and a double and single pullout (we noticed some people with 6 people or more in rooms). The resort: The best thing about this resort is not the rooms but the location. Situated directly on the ocean, with two large pools and a hot tub (we used this lots even though its Maui), we were close to some great snorkling on a cove just a 3 minute walk away, and only 1 minute by foot to a beautiful sandy beach. It was handy having the Gazebo Restaurant on location as well (best breakfast ever), however, be prepared to wait in line as much as 15 minutes. For us with our kids, we were really happy to see many other younger couples with kids all over the place, and were able to let our kids run around in the big open grassy area where we could watch them and the whales in the ocean from our patio. If you are looking for quiet and relaxing, this isnt the place for you (try Napili Point next door). During the days the pools were full of kids, and they were running around everywhere. There was definately a younger feel to this resort which we liked, and just sitting by the pool you could chat someone up easy enough. The resort also has a great lounging spot right up by the ocean where alot of people would sit and watch the whales and the surf. Maintenance and groudskeeping were very good, and the grills were always cleaned and well maintained. Although we never had any issues, were heard some people complain about the lack of parking. Food at the other restaurant on the resort was average, however, prices were fairly good. When reading reviews about this resort, alot of people complained about all the kids, or, kids under 5 being in the hot tub. There were certainly alot of energetic kids running around (mine included), and people seemed to disregard the kids under 5 in the hot tub rule. In summary, though the rooms were nothing special in my opinion, we had a great time and would certainly come back. The resort was very friendly, and optimally situated in my opinion. I thought prices were a little high for a one bedroom though, larger 2-bedroom units are available at other resorts if you look around a bit, however, this resort is well located, which is important too. Do in Maui: highly recommend the Road to Hana (stop at the Lava Tubes, the Black Sands beach (jump in the hidden pools down the path to the right), and The Seven Sacred Pools) , a Luau, renting a convertible, visiting Front Street in Lahaina, going whale watching, snorkling Molikini, trying a Mai Tai, visit the aquarium in Ma'alea (spelling?) visiting the blowholes north of Napili, taking a surfing lesson, and visiting Fleming Beach (be careful in the big waves). Check out Bubba Gump's on Front Street in Lahaina, also, the two storey burger place next to it (cant remember name). Be sure to get a seat upstairs for the live music. Feel free to message me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: DenAndJean
Reviews.Content: The grounds at the Napili Shores are very well maintained and our Studio Condo was well decorated and very clean. We had a Garden View overlooking the courtyard pool, another pool is located right by the ocean. Lots of tall palm, colorful plants and flowers decorate the central court between the banks of condos. There is a beautiful sandy beach a couple of minutes walk to the North of the property. The Gazebo Restaurant by the pool and beach, serves up amazing breakfasts and lunch, the line up starts more than a half hour before it opens. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is secluded in a quiet, small hotel and residential area just a short walk from Kapalua, Lahaina is a 10-15 minute drive to the South with Whalers Village shopping in between. This is a great alternative to staying in a big highrise hotel, a more relaxed and intimate atmosphere without the crowds. There are several new Weber barbeques at your disposal to cook up a nice meal without the expense of a restaurant. The rooms have wired internet access, but wireless wifi in the lobby. We would stay again at Napili Shores if we return to Maui, and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great access to amazing beach”
Reviews.Author: chriscat111
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Outrigger Napili Shores. We booked through Donna Bender who is an Outrigger Specialist. Couldn't have been more pleased with our stay. Room had everything we needed (from Blender to boogie boards) and great access to a fab beach at Napili. Would defo return!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, covenient....just a little thin on the walls!”
Reviews.Author: TrishMike
Reviews.Content: After staying 4 nights at another condo, Napili shores was a welcome change. Comfortable and convenient with 2 great restaurants on site...breakfast in the gazebo and dinner in the dining room are both well priced and well done! Napili beach is beuatiful and the turtles in the adjacent bay made snorkling easy and enjoyable. Our only negative comment is the thin walls. We heard ice cubes falling into a glass next door, early alarms and late night voices....perhaps not enough to say we wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Theresa O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in to our room just in time for the 2nd half of the Superbowl. (Thanks, NY Giants, for my Vegas bet win!) We had a 2nd floor garden view room, but we were able to see the ocean when we looked out and right. I LOVED turning the flat screen tv toward the balcony so my husband and I could enjoy the Superbowl as we toasted with a bottle of wine in the fresh air. One of my favorite memories of our recent Maui trip! Also, the mac nut pancakes at the Gazebo restaurant are worth the wait in line... and that line was LONG! No A/C in the rooms but it wasn't bad at all in mid February. We had a 2nd floor unit so if you have heavy bags, that could be a hassle. (Just think of lifting your bags as your workout.) We only stayed two nights but plan to stay longer next time. Front desk staff is very nice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, location so so”
Reviews.Author: kerrylobrutto
Reviews.Content: THE LOCATION: If you are familiar with Maui and have stayed before you know all this, but the Outrigger is about a 15 minute drive south to Lahaina and all the restaurants and shops. It is a short walk to Napili Bay which doesn't have a good beach for lounging, but it is good for swimming. Kapalua Bay is 5 minutes drive North and is great for families and snorkeling! The Outrigger is 5 minutes drive from Napili plaza and market- but buy all your groceries at Costco close to airport when you arrive, otherwise you will be blown away by cost! One downside of this location is there are NO sidewalks around resorts, so going out for a morning stroll or after dinner is a bit dangerous- definitely not good for walking the stroller or with small children. THE RESORT: The grounds of this condo resort are very well manicured, with two pools and a jacuzzi. We stayed in Garden View Condo unit #134. So this review reflects just that condo, all are owned separately and can be varying quality. Even though it was close to the onsite restaurant, it was still very quiet. I can imagine the units closest to the Gazebo (nearest the ocean) could be a little noisy in the morning as that restaurant always had a line starting at 7 am! It was updated and modern, King size bed, flat screen TV, granite counter tops in kitchenette and bathroom, large closet in bathroom. As two people we were very comfortable in this space. The kitchenette was well equip with full size refrigerator which was great for us because we cooked almost all of our meals in condo., blender, toaster, etc. Except the two pans are TERRIBLE (too small and definitely not none stick anymore), no tupperwear present for packing lunches, so buy some or bring sandwich bags and freezer bags for food and left over storage. I would recommend this to a friend! But next time we will stay more south and in a better walking environment. We were always in the car!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: texchef2
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at Napili Shores and both trips were great. We had a garden facing room this time but could still hear the ocean waves at night. We were located on the north side and didn't notice any undue noise before the 'quiet hours' were over at 8am. At night, I don't think I've experienced a more quiet location-it is very mellow and laid back and it seems most folks return to the resort in the early evening, so few car noises were heard. It appears that the Gazebo wholesale deliveries are in the afternoon to avoid both the restaurant crowds and disturbing guests on that side of the resort. The one bedroom condo, managed by Outrigger, was clean, well furnished and well equipped for a long stay. The new restaurant, Cafe Au Lait, is average and a bit pricey, but a real plus for tired travelers at the end of the day. This is an excellent resort for many reasons. I have to say that I find the concerns about treatment of 'children in the hot tub' overstated, as this is the policy in all the resorts I've ever known. The parents who 'violated' that policy during our stay were the only rude, loud folks we encountered on the entire trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, Noisy property”
Reviews.Author: emily32
Reviews.Content: We had an okay time at Nalipi Shores. The property is nice, however there were a few problems with it. The first is the noise, as isulation between the bedroom walls and the parking lot was minimal. This wouldn't have been so bad, except that there was a significant amount of traffic going through the parking lot to get to the restaurant. Second, the lower pool is not heated, so it is basically useless. The upper pool is nice, however, if you have kids, be prepared for some serious stares from the older people. Also - KIDS NOT ALLOWED IN HOT TUB!!! Very disapointing, as Napili is more windy than the rest of Maui, and it is nice for the kids to warm up. The beach was nice, however I would not recommend it for small children in the winter, as the waves are large, and break right on shore.

Reviews.Title: “7 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: lovemexico70
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this resort where we stayed for 3 weeks in total.. No a/c is right and yes the wind does blow through but not quite enough for me, so luckily i had asked for a fan and did use it at night..Watch out for the bread delivery guy at 5;30 in the morning,, just on the one side,,people parking early for the famous Gazabo restraunt, locking there cars and slamming doors..Trying to get there early for 7'30 opening,,As the other review says, kids are okay, it's the parents who can't control them. The barbecues were great to have, they do clean them well and the grounds were kept great. Gal at the front desk was a little iffy,, not a great first impression.. But it was a great place to head out from to go do the sight seeing........Definately need a car,,or I noticed the bus stopped right outside the resort,, A little to expensive for eating out etc and will not head back to Maui any time soon.........

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiimax
Reviews.Content: I don't know what hotel some of the other reviewers went to, maybe they just didn't know what to expect. This is a very nice place to stay. You don't need A/C as the fans in all the rooms do a very good job of keeping things cool along with the Trades. I have been there the last 2 years and plan to go back often. The Gazebo is an excellent place to eat-affordable and very good food and generous portions. Yes there is a line most of the day when they are open, 7:30-2:00 but that is because the food is good and fairly priced. If you don't want a line of people at the pool you are lounging by, go to the one higher up on the hill-you can enjoy the hottub next to that pool too. If you are looking for a clean, affordable place to stay that is not where the crowd is, consider the Napili Shores.

Reviews.Title: “NO SMOKING, No A/C”
Reviews.Author: SkyHighturbo007
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, we learned the entire property is designated as non-smoking. I have no problem not smoking inside the unit, but having to walk out to the street to the nearest, and only, "smoking site" is extreme...then to find no ashtrays, shade, or seating...unless you sit on the jagged lava wall. The next surprise was the lack of air conditioning. I sleep better in a cool room, so hours after I wanted to retire, it had cooled enough that I could eventually fall asleep. Due to the lack of a/c, the ground floor sliding glass door had to remain open to get the maximum airflow. That did not encourage a deep, sound sleep. Nor did the click, click, click of the ceiling fan in the bedroom. As to privacy, forget it. I am now sitting near the middle of the living room and looking into ten other living rooms, on two floors. Abouth thirty yards away, the older couple on their lanai (patio) look through our living room, kitchen, hallway to the bathroom, and into our bedroom. The only curtains are heavy and coated, with no shear curtains to allow privacy and still have ventilation. Oh, the bedroom window opens to the parking lot, so car doors being closed are the urban version of a rooster. Thankfully, the baby in the next unit sleeps through the night. The unit is adaquately furnished and well maintained, but I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't need A/C”
Reviews.Author: Koontzie
Reviews.Content: I am way behind on this review, but I want to give it anyway. This was place was great, and good for families even though it was just adults that went. Has a great breakfast restaurant on site. The only think I did not like was no A/C, if the trade winds don't blow, It get's too warm. If you don't care about A/C it's great. This isn't a hotel it's probably a condo conversion. If you want 4-5 star stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LAguy888
Reviews.Content: Recently took part in a wedding at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua but decided not to stay at the Ritz due to the price. Ended up splitting a little rental condo at Napili Shores with 2 friends. It was tight for 3 guys, but met our needs just fine. The interior wasn't much to speak of. Very simple, very small. But the location more than made up for it, and split three ways, it was very inexpensive. The restaurant on site is so popular for breakfast that we actually never ate there (the lines were just ridiculous). You can walk down from the place to a gorgeous, popular beach. The front desk helped us get paddle boards and snorkel gear as well. The Ritz was certainly much nicer and with far more service, but location-wise Napili Shores was actually better, mostly because it was easier to access the beach.

Reviews.Title: “that was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tatius
Reviews.Content: We were searching for condos on the water with snorkeling preferable a low rise, and out off the major roads. We found this Napili Shores condo complex at Napili Bay with a studio with ocean and garden view at second floor just steps from the sand beach and turtle bay. It was very clean with a maid service each 3 days, and with fully equipped kitchen. Free parking is just behind your building. This resort is located on Napili Bay, which has very nice snorkeling and a group of giant turtles that come out every morning on the rocks to the left of the sand beach. Awesome to watch! Gazebo Restaurant is on a property, but we did not try it. There are few places not far from the resort that we would recommend: 1) Turn left from the resort's gate, and drive 12 minutes, there is a great snorkeling at Kapalua Bay. You should walk through a private forest to get on a rock beach. 2) on the hill right side of this Bay is surfers area. That was interesting to watch surfers in a windy day; there is a plenty of place for the parking, just turn left on a hill from the road 3) Drive further, there is a Blown Hole place, you find out it by a small sign on your left just along the road. There is a quite walk down to the water, approx 20 minutes, but the view of Blown Hole is deserved it! 4) Keep driving to the next attraction - Kahakuloa Head. Be aware that HWY 30 after Blown Hole area is became extremely narrow, pretty scary to drive on, and better turn around if you are not assured in your driving skills. Kaheliki Highway is not in a good maintenance conditions. We would not recommend keep driving next behind the Blown Hole area for the beginners. Overall, that was awesome! Few tips: that place is a bit far from the major attractions like Road to Hana, Haliakala volcano, etc hence you should be leaving approx one hour earlier than from all other places on Maui. To drive to Haliakala summit took us about 3.5 hours with a few short stops for the photos. Because this place at a bottom of a small volcano, the rainy days in average are more than on the south, Kihei. Sand beach is beautiful and safety. Hiking trails are from the beach leads you along the west shore Resortâ€™s garden, pools, hot tab, BBQ areas are all absolutely amazing! Napili market is just 2 minutes from the resort. Few restaurants are around. Closest town Lahaina is 12 minutes drive by hwy30. We would recommend this place to families and couples who love stay at quiet places.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: blanche195111
Reviews.Content: This resort was just what we were looking for. Clean, well stocked kitchen and so close to the beach. We were there for Thanksgiving and found it quite quiet for the holiday. We love the family atmosphere even though we are newly retired. The grounds are immaculate and the staff very friendly. The maid service was fabulous. We loved the beach and I read somewhere that Napili Beach is "more fun per square foot" than any other beach. We concur. We travelled with our daughter, son-in-law and five year old grandaughter and we all had a fantastic time. We will return!! We also loved the Seahouse Restaurant for the happy hour. Very affordable and tasty. If there were to be a negative, I suppose needing a car for sure would be the issue. We found that the driving was fine. Did anyone else notice that most of the rental cars, although new, were dented and scratched up.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Napili”
Reviews.Author: PDXN
Reviews.Content: I did my research before my first trip to Maui, and settled on Napili because it's a bit more out of the touristy area, yet close enough to hop in the car and get see other parts of the west coast of the island. As others have mentioned, you're going to want to rent a car. We stayed in a garden studio unit in the building facing the upper pool/jacuzzi area. The room was more spacious than I imagined. Along with the sleeping area, it had a big bathroom/closet area (no bathtub, FYI), and very complete kitchen set-up, which was fantastic. Both the bathroom and kitchen looked newly remodeled with granite counter tops, but I don't believe all of the units were as fixed up as ours (I can't confirm this). My partner and I were there over Thanksgiving, so the complex was pretty full--a mix of couples and families with young kids. Because of the kids, it wasn't as quite as I had hoped for a couple get-away--but you can't blame kids for being early risers, just parents for not keeping their kids under control. The other thing I noticed was that despite a policy about keeping kids under 12 out of the jacuzzi, parents disregarded this completely. Overall, if you can get past those small things, the location and everything else is amazing and I would return. The grounds and room were well kept, the staff was helpful, and I feel good about my choice to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but spend all our time in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: thomasthorsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the ocean view building (not the ocean front which is directly next to the ocean), and the room was excellent, well equipped (kitchen gear) and with a great view of the ocean with the Gazebo restaurant and pool area in the foreground. The beach was quite a bit smaller than we expected, and the narrow strip out of reach of the waves was mostly used for people walking by, leaving very little space for relaxation and sun bathing. Perhaps we were unlucky but it was quite windy every day on our 5 day stay, and actually we didn't go to the Napili beach a single time, nor did we use the pool. Instead we went south to the Kaanapali beach area where the wind happened to be not as noticeable, and the Whaler Village was a great place to go for lunch or dinner. The surroundings in Napili are quite dull, with few restaurants, and you definitely need a car unless you want to walk a long distance to shop for groceries. In the end, we actually wished that we had booked one of the hotels or apartments near the Kaanapali beach area instead, because that's were we ended up spending our time anyway. I'm not saying this resort is bad at all, and i know Napili has a large and dedicated following, but your should weigh carefully what your priorities are before you pick Napili over Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place For Us”
Reviews.Author: ladmcski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a neighbor island weekend while relatives stayed at the Ritz Carlton. We really enjoyed this Outrigger. Rooms were clean and roomy, with a kitchen and lanai. We faced the sparkling pool, and walked right out onto the gorgeous beach for some snorkeling. The Gazebo, a good place for breakfast, was on the premises. Staff was friendly and very helpful. This place was not luxurious, but sure suited our needs. A short ride from Lahaina. We'd love to stay here again when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: mhr2011
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Napili Shores and have enjoyed both times immensely. The condos are nicely outfitted with a full kitchen and comfy beds. The two pools are very nice and the grounds kept in excellent shape. You are just a short stroll to the Napili Bay beach with good snorkeling and swimming. It is not a highend resort so go to the Ritz up the road if you like spending money to make yourself feel special. But if you want nice, quiet and clean you can't beat Napili Shores!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelPhile2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a sports event and really enjoyed it. The front desk staff was friendly, and the location is wonderful. Facing the ocean, to your right, is a calm, beautiful beach with good snorkeling. And just around the corner to your left is a small cove with coral and tons of sea turtles! There are two pools, one overlooking the ocean and one up the hill with a hot tub. We enjoyed the hot tub. And as for the rooms, they are very spacious with full kitchens and large bathrooms (but no bathtub, if that matters to you). Within walking distance of some amazing restaurants and a 10 minute drive to the main shopping area in Lahaina. It was a peaceful, nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location, not so the bed”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelCA
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio unit in this complex based on the recommendation of friends. The location is beautiful and the grounds of the complex are immaculate. The clerk at the reception was very "matter of fact", not too friendly. We found the unit (G256) nice, and VERY clean. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need including a dishwasher. The big issue with this unit was the bed (a Murphy bed). it is a queen size and was not as comfortable as can be expected. All they need to do is replace the mattress to something of a higher quality. There is a partial view of the ocean which was nice. The walk to the beach is pretty short if you use the side gate, which I believe originally required a room key to enter but is now broken and anybody can enter. There is a wired internet connection in the room, which dropped a couple of times. We called the front desk and they were very quick in contacting their internet provider. They clean the room evry 3rd day of your stay, which is fine except for the fact that it would be nice if they emptied the trash cans a little more often...I would really give this place a "4" if the bed was better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalparadise1106
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise when we stayed here a week ago. Absolutely beautiful location and rooms. Great swimming/snorkeling on site. There was no ac as mentioned, but it was not needed and it was in the high 80s during our stay. Very close to shops, grocery. Quick drive to Kaanapali and Lahaina areas. Make sure to check out snorkeling north of area and blowhole. Did not eat here, but looked great.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY ENJOYED IT! Dina,Montreal, QC, CANADA”
Reviews.Author: DINA P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Outrigger from August 4th thru 11th. Had a wonderful time. Staff was very pleasant. They provided us an upgrade to a one bedroom condo garden view. I agree that the beds and sofa bed could be upgraded but i think that was the only drawback. Beach was great for families! Great for snorkeling. The weather was an experience - it would rain in the morning and clear up and then some more showers later in the day...didn't mind it at all!! Free internet which was a bonus. Pool was very nice to freshen us off later in the day. We found that the fans and with the windows opened were sufficient - a nice cool breeze. My daughter loved it!! Went to Honalulu afterwards and stayed at the Hyatt - guess what no pool (under renovation) no internet (you had to pay) guest laundromat (highway robbery)!!! So u know what staying at the Outrigger was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: fromAlabama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last leg of our vacation. The service desk was very helpful and supplied anything we needed. The rooms were average, very clean, and the noise level of other guests outside were a little loud at times. We tried eating breakfast at the gazebo each morning but the line was always too long. The pool was average. The beach area was fantastic, one of my favorite beaches that we visited. It had plenty of shade when we needed it and we had a sea turtle or two swim among us. This was the least expensive place that we stayed on our trip. Nothing about this place is bad, but we weren't blown away either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: FairfaxCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Master bed and sofa pullout were both very poor quality. Plan on going to the chiropractor when you get home. Dishware was pitiful - plus cooking pots were cheap - no vegetable steamer. No beach items i.e., boogie boards, big towels, or games provided for families. Staff was very pleasant. The main restaurant was dirty and mediocre. All the bedrooms had windows to the parking lot and garbage area, very noisy during the night. Great Beach north of condo and the best snorkeling south of the condo.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friend Hotel - works great for Friends”
Reviews.Author: kaicavalier
Reviews.Content: Really basic hotel rooms, but spacious with high ceilings and full kitchen with dishes, silverware and pots/pans, etc. Large bathrooms with double sinks and stand up shower. No bath in our room. We loved the onsite Gazebo breakfast. It's worth the 45 minute wait for the macademia, pineapple and banana pancakes. The beach nearby is gorgeous and the snorkeling is fabulous. We'd definitely stay here again!!! And great price.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic, clean place whose nearby beach makes up for lack of air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: TheBlitz
Reviews.Content: As my wife and I walked around, we couldn't help but notice there were grinning children of all ages running around everywhere. They seemed to love the place: the pools, the rocks, the beach nearby, being with their families. This is a nice, reasonably priced center for fun. Pros: Room is lovely and spacious. Kitchen comes with enough quality stuff to throw a dinner party for a half dozen people. These weren't pots and pans from Goodwill; this was stuff you'd use to cook and serve at your second home. Sizeable bathroom area. Great views. Lovely grounds with plants in bloom. Napili Bay is just a wonderful beach, with snorkeling and swimming and all the good stuff you want in a sandy beach. We usually visit the Big Island, which has rockier beaches, so we loved this aspect. Assuming you have a car, and since this is Hawaii and you have common sense, you will, there's a market nearby and some good restaurants like China Boat not far away. Cons: 1. The lack of air conditioning sucks. I don't know that it's a big deal if you have kids as the rooms are still tolerable at worst in August. Now if you're a couple ... If you plan to do ... um, what couples do ... you better have a couple that likes to do it in the morning when things are still cool, let's put it that way. You can get a nice cross breeze going but that's with the windows all wide open, so the couple also better be on the quiet side, if you know what I mean. 2. The windows wide open means you get a lot of noise, from the pools, recreation areas, or people walking the parking lot. Maui is a lot windier than the Big Island, I learned, and sometimes the cross breeze means you get the whistling of wind in the rooms. We go on dives and sleep a bit in the afternoon, but we got by. 3. You do need a car, but this is Hawaii so that makes sense. I'd stay here again in a minute though if I found a comparable place with air conditioning, I'd give it a try too. Frankly, we're likely to just stick to the less crowded and less expensive Big Island, but that's no reflection on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most AMAZING honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: jl_daniel23
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am a travel agent. I send a LOT of clients over to Maui, but I have never had anyone stay at this Outrigger property before. I wanted to try something different and a little more 'off the grid' for our honeymoon, and I have heard good things about the Napili area. My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon in Maui at the Outrigger Napili Shores (July 25-31). Words and pictures will never be able to describe how beautiful everything was. We were SO pleased with our accommodations at the Outrigger Napili Shores. We were in a garden view studio (the cheapest room), and it was everything we could have asked for. Nice interior decor, kitchen, bathroom, etc. Fully stocked with all the dishes we needed and a fridge. There is no air conditioner at this resort, however, we NEVER missed not having it. There are screened porches and balconies for every room, we just left ours open the entire trip. The resort has a great breakfast/lunch place called the Gazebo that is WONDERFUL (try the POG). There is a place open Tuesday-Saturday for dinner on site that was also very good and we ate at two nights. There are two very nice pools on site (if that's your thing, we always swam at the beach though). Also, you can sit in the patio area and see the most beautiful sunsets. You look out towards the west and it sets right over Molokai. Napili bay itself is absolutely beautiful. In front of the resort is a reef where sea turtles and other marine life hang out at (great snorkel spot also, try Boss Frog's in Napili Marketplace a few blocks away for cheap rentals). The sandy bay is adjacent to the reef and perfect for swimming and just hanging out. Attractions worth doing while in Maui that we did: 1) Pride of Maui Molokini and Turtle Town snorkel cruise (more expensive than others, but very nice lunch and drinks included! The staff was absolutely wonderful and very friendly). Also drop by the Maui Aquarium in Maalaea after the cruise for a neat experience, it's in the same parking lot as the harbor. 2) Twin Falls on the Road to Hana (First stop on the highway, we were told if you can only do part of the road, do Twin Falls). Wear your swimsuit so you can swim at the falls! Pack a lunch and visit Haleakela in the same day. 3) Haleakela (We drove from Twin falls on a little highway that hooked up to Haleakela highway and did the crater on the same day, worked out VERY well. Be prepared to bring long pants and a jacket because it was very cold and windy when we went, but still worth the drive). 4) Merriman's restaurant in Kapalua (Walking distance from the Outrigger Napili Shores, very expensive, but TOTALLY worth the money. You need reservations! All the locals said this place was better than Mama's Fish House). I will definitely recommend this property to individuals who are looking to be a little outside of town (only a 15 minute drive to Lahaina) and feel a little more secluded. Perfect if you just want something simple and a little more remote feeling than a high-rise property. Beautiful scenery, great food, great excursions! The property itself prices VERY well compared to some other units in the Lahaina area, so you have plenty leftover for great meals and day-trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Redwinelvr
Reviews.Content: We recently took a family trip to Napili Shores. We had a nice stay due to the views and location but experienced extremely poor service from front desk management. Pros: -Beautiful views -Fully equipped kitchens and BBQ's -Quiet and away from touristy area -Good snorkeling Cons: -Poor customer service. Extremely unfriendly and not accommodating. -Gazebo Restaurant. While it is nice to have a restaurant on the property, it is not very convenient as a guest. You have to stand in an hour+ line to eat there. It is located right next to one of the swimming pools, and the line of people makes it unbearable to relax at the pool until after the restaurant closes after 2PM. We paid to have an ocean front room, and were disturbed by the breakfast crowds starting at 7AM. -Not many restaurants in the area to walk to. Unless you plan on only eating in, you definitely need to rent a car. -Only 1 pool towel, and you cannot exchange them until 10AM. -No room service, or pool bar. Due to the poor customer service, we will not be returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient, but check ocean view vs. oceanfront rooms”
Reviews.Author: AmyR50
Reviews.Content: The condos at the Outrigger Napili Shores are in a great location, next to the beach, have two great pools and a hot tub, grills and kitchens, nice staff. There were many families there, so it's not necessarily a "Couples" retreat, but we did like having the option to cook there, as many (though not all) dinners on Maui are expensive. Try the Maui Brewery and Aloha Plate in Lahaina and the Sea House n the beach for breakfast. The "ocean view" was not much a view, so we upgraded to "oceanfront" - now I understand the difference! Oceanfront is much more private and you can hear the waves. Note: Garden view is not at all private. Napili Beach is awesome for swimming and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location Great for Families Best Beach in Maui”
Reviews.Author: mauilovermomoftwo
Reviews.Content: The best cove and beach in Maui and we have been to Maui 4 times. We love Napili! Don't get the rooms by the parking lot though because people come in and walk by talking to go to the famous breakfast place. That part is a bummer but the rest is great. We didn't even miss air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place and great snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: Marinemama
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place and the snorkeling was awesome in the little bay 2 minutes from our room. It was clean, comfortable and roomy! Eden, the lady from Expedia that helps to book your outings was awesome! She was so helpful in so many ways. I won't go back to Maui but we sure had a great time and most of the scenery was beautiful. Maui Magic snorkeling boat was great. The crew and the food was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: twohyeb
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 wonderful days at Napili Shores. The room was clean and comfortable for our family of four, including two teenagers. The kitchen was well stocked, the pools were great, and the resort a good mix of activity during the day and quiet at night. We got a right online that was tremendously reasonable - and with each passing day we felt we got an even better value. We loved walking to some of the best snorkeling around - getting face to face with dozens of sea turtles, and having "turtle bay" nearly to ourselves in the late afternoon. We were also able indulge in the fabulous pancakes at the Gazebo restaurant without the lines by getting take out and eating right in our room. We walked right out to the great beach at Napili and loved being so close the the sights on the northwestern side of the island - Honolua Bay and the Marine Sanctuary for more great snorkeling just 5 minutes up the road, the coastal walk at Kapalua, and blowhole. The hustle and bustle of Kaanapali and Lahaina are also only a few minutes away, but it is easy to just stay at Napili the whole time and be very, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to R E L A X”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep it simple! Pros: * Large room, clean and comfortable with a great kitchen. We had an ocean view but any room would be fine as the gardens are pretty, so there is no "bad view". *Location of Napili Bay - Very pretty crescent shaped bay. It doesn't matter at all that the shores is not DIRECTLY on the beach. The bay is seriously a few metres walk! *Turtles!! - Go to the bay at Napili Point (turn left and snorkel in the bay around the corner there). We initially tried Napili Bay and didn't see any but there were soo many at Napili Point, they were really beautiful to see. * The resort it general is just very laid back. You can't help but relax. Cons: * No bar at the pool. I'm not sure why the Gazebo isn't licensed. We felt this was the one thing missing. It would be so nice if you could have a cocktail and even order some snacks while you are relaxing there. * Not a great deal of eateries within walking distance. There is the Gazebo restaurant on site open for breakfast and lunch and the Cafe O Lei on site, open for dinner. There is also the Seahouse restaurant at the nearby Napili Kai (great happy hour), but other than that I don't think there is anywhere else that would be walking distance. But I suppose that is what the kitchen facilities are for! We were tossing up between staying here and the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. There is definately more "going on" in Kaanapali as all the resorts are all next to each other right along the beach. It really just depends what you think would suit you better. I'm glad we chose Napili Bay instead because I liked that it was more secluded. We had a hire car so still visited Kaanapali (10 min drive). The bus is only $2 return if you don't have a car and it stops right out front of the Napili shores. *** Lastly, Both my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed all of the dinners we had at the Cafe O Lei restaurant. The Gazebo always gets praised and yes the pancakes were nice but we thought Cafe O Lei really was fantastic and our favourite of the two. The Macadamia nut chicken was the best***

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mlmarkley
Reviews.Content: The beach front rooms are totally worth it. An amazing view over the bay and across to the other island. Chairs to take to the beach were a great surprise. Stayed solo but could have thrown a dinner party with the kitchen accessories. Wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Magical........”
Reviews.Author: OBSusan
Reviews.Content: Loved this place; will be coming back every year.....perfect location, with Napili Bay and snorkeling, close to Lahaina and Honolua Bay...Gazebo great breakfasts. The ocean view and beautiful gardens with birds singing in the morning was amazing and relaxing. Sea House restaurant has amazing sunsets and if you just order a few appetizers you don't have to spend a fortune. Napili market and snorkel Bob's close by. In short, a perfect vacation spot!! LOVED it and as I said, will be back next year and for years to come!! Don't change a thing!!

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: 41954Vacation10
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Maui where I went with my younger daughter for her school vacation week. We couldn't have picked a more perfect place. Outrigger Napili Shores was awesome. The people who work the front dest could not have been nicer and knew how to treat guest. They were very knowledgeable about their jobs and the island. The rooms are clean and have everything you need in them. The location is great. So pretty...right on the ocean and 2 great pools on the property and close to 2 great beaches . The Gazebo Resturant on the ocean on the property has the best breakfast around. I can't wait to go back.......

Reviews.Title: “Simple Heaven”
Reviews.Author: h2ocolourmom
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful week at Napili Shores, this is our 5th vacation there. What I love about the place is.. it's an incredible location, and simple. There's no la dee dah here, just incredibly beautiful surroundings only steps from the beach. The condos are well appointed and attractive, views are breathtaking, the staff is nice, the on-site Gazebo Restaurant is a fabulous spot for breakfast or lunch (Can you see the whales and turtles from your table? YES!) You only have to put on your flip flops, grab a book and walk a few steps to the beach and you're in Heaven. Napili Bay is a wonderful spot for snorkeling, body surfing and just strolling. No huge parking lots, no 30 story ride in an elevator, no lobby the size of Milwaukee - you are where you wanna be in one minute. Enjoy a glass of wine by the pool at sunset, 20 feet from the ocean. Then grill your favorite fish for dinner and you're set. If it's simple relaxation and a fabulous beach you want, with all the other stuff (shop, eat, golf, cars, crowds) very near by.... Napili.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & relax with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cocobeadz
Reviews.Content: My daughter was at the front desk requesting extra towels; before walking back to the room, they were already delivered! The room was clean & location was close to the market when items were needed. The beach was just a few feet away with turtles eating their dinner. My 10 yr grandchild was usually last one in the ocean in the evening as the area is safe & currents weren't strong. Arrived early for a Gabezo breakfast, its a must to be hungry & enjoyed shopping at the 'store'. The only lesson learned for the future, don't have dinner at Cafe O'le. My grandchilds cheeseburger was served raw, ugh! Other than that, there's literally no traffic to fight & family is talking about our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quiet get away”
Reviews.Author: Trav1677
Reviews.Content: My travel agent, who used to live in Maui, recommended this place as one of her favorite hidden gems, and it did not dissappoint! To start with the, the location was amazing. The pool overlooks the ocean and its just a short walk to a beautiful beach with great sand and snorkeling. The grounds were beautiful; plumeria trees, palms, orchids, koi ponds. My boyfriend and I traveled by ourselves, but the grounds seemed great for families/groups; BBQ spots, big lawns, shuffleboard. There is a great lawn area perfect for watching the sunsets. The location was a short drive to the more touristy areas, but I thought the drive was worth the relaxing secluded feeling. I am not sure if all the rooms are the same, as I believe they are individually owned condos, but ours was exceptional. We had a studio with a full kitchen, complete with granite counter tops. Everything was exceptionally clean and the whole place was very quiet and restful. I was concerned after reading some of the other reviews on Trip Advisor that mentioned there were little bugs in the room, but we did not have any problems. There were a few tiny ants we found, but I attribute that to us leaving food out overnight. There are 2 restaurants on the grounds, and both were very good. The Gazebo restaurant is literally overlooking the water and is open for breakfast and lunch. I swear they served the best breakfast I ever eaten - if you decide to stay here don't miss the Macadamia Nut Pancakes with Coconut Syrup and Whipped Cream! I'm still thinking about how good they were! I advise to get up early, it is a very small restaurant and there will be a line waiting to get in. We called in our orders to go and ate by the pool to bypass the line. The restaurant that serves dinner was great, too, and had a nice bar. The only thing was that it was closed Sunday & Monday. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Maui, we had a great stay and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MyYorkies
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice small condo type of hotel with a Hawaiian feel to it, this is the place. It is not a typical highrise with fancy swimming pools. However, it has a wonderful restaurant for breakfast & lunch where people start to line up at 8:00 a.m. to get in. Needless to say we have eaten there many times, even when we didn't stay at this hotel. It also has a nice restaurant on premises for dinner. We found our one bedroom condo extremely comfortable and didn't mind the fact that there was no air conditioning. Plenty of ceiling fans throughout the unit. The condo was definately upgraded with all conveniences; the grounds are very nice with two small pools and quiet in the evening. The Napili Shores is close to lots of other restaurants, Lahaina, Whalers Village, beaches and yet it is nice to get back to the hotel for a quiet rest at night. We really liked the location. Would definately recommend for people who like the "lay back" atmosphere unlike Kaanapali or other areas which are much more crowded. Great place to whale watch too. Only complaint is that bedrooms face parking lot and morning noise can be a problem with other guests leaving and driving through. Would recommend a room facing ocean and further from street noice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: suga44
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel as the location was wonderful and the staff was very nice and helpful. The room is very clean and very comfortable. Lots of room for a family of 4 or less per room. The only thing that I didn't care for was the group of families with 8+ kids that played soccer in the grass area at 6:30 in the morning. Our room was right there and because of the no A/C, the doors and windows were open all night in order to get cool air in the room. So, we were all awake at 6:30 by thier yelling and kicking the ball around. This is wonderful for them but not so good for us as our young kids normally would sleep in until 7:30 or 8. I wish the hotel would have enforce the "quiet time rules of 10pm-8am as much as they did the jacuzzi rule of "no children under 12 allowed".....which they did heavily inforce. But, that is probably a rare issue and I would still stay here every time I visit Maui. LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “In Maui for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: MyFamilyL0ves2travel
Reviews.Content: I flew in for a wedding on March 1st, 2011 and stayed 2 nights @ this condo resort. I chose it because of the location to wedding and after dinner party location. 2 minutes away:) I traveled alone and felt very safe. Hotel was full of families and right on Napali Bay/Beach. Saw whales in the morning while eating macadamia pancakes with coconut syrup. (delish!!) at the Gazebo restaurant. (located ocean front @ hotel) Very large, clean studio rooms with full kitchens and free internet. Mine had a view of the pool and gardens. It was very comfortable and quiet. until morning when everyone heads to breakfast and gets in pool around 7:30-8:30am. which was fine. who wants to sleep in Maui! Quiet time is 10pm, which was nice and parking was free. Staff was okay. front desk lady on March 2nd was rude when I asked her when the restaurant opened for breakfast. check in staff on March 1st were great:) overall, It was a nice stay. very beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good food, clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Perrschy
Reviews.Content: On our first big trip with our baby we decided to stay at the Outrigger Napili Shores. The location is excellent: right by the beautiful beach. If the waves are rougher, it's perfect for boogie boarding, if it's calmer it's excellent for snorkeling - there are lots of sea turtles around (which you can also see from the shore). There are two pools which are not too exciting, but they definitely suffice for a relaxed day at the pool. Also, make sure to check out the Gazebo. The restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch and offers delicious food for a reasonable price (~ $10 per dish). There's usually a huge line up so give them a call 10 minutes ahead and you can just pick up your food and eat it on your balcony (or where you like, of course). Our room was very tidy. Although the hotel is on the older side, everything is kept updated and clean. We stayed in an ocean front room which is perfect if you don't mind the sound of the waves (we didn't, we loved it!!!). I think it's great that the rooms don't have A/C. Thus you're "forced" to keep the windows open and you hear the ocean all the time. Non-ocean front rooms are probably rather garden view than ocean view so treat yourself with an ocean front room - it's so worth it. We loved to sit on the balcony, have breakfast and see the humpback whales swimming by (or breaching!). The staff is very friendly. Of course, our baby (5 months) was always welcome :) Also, we liked the fact that housekeeping is only every three days. It made it much more relaxed as we wanted to stay out of the sun during noon with our baby and so it was always a good idea to take a nap in the room and not being interrupted by housekeeping. Also, the dinner restaurant is quite good. We went there the last night and the seafood is great. Also the dessert (upside-down pineapple cake) is worth mentioning! Yummy!!! Long story short: An excellent hotel for people looking for a relaxed vacation. We'll definitely come back and we can recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and close to fun”
Reviews.Author: zafaglass
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back a few hours ago from Outrigger and already miss it. It is a relaxing atmosphere, pretty quiet overall but close enough to places like Lahaina or Kaanapali if you want some nightlife and Hawaiian culture (ie luaus and the like). It is right on Napili Bay which is nice. Some days there were great waves for playing in and other days were very calm in the water which allowed for some great snorkeling. The beach is nice and sandy, but those aren't hard to come by in Maui. During the winter months, when the whales come around the area for mating and giving birth, you literally can see them all over the place from this area. The best times to see them were in the morning and around 5 pm or so. Nothing better than waking up in the morning, getting some of their tasty free coffee and whale watching before hitting up the days fun in the sun. The Gazebo, which is a breakfast/lunch place right on the property has some seriously amazing pancakes and the fried rice is unbelievable, not only in size but in quantity too. We only ate there once, but highly recommend it. The only downside is that there is a pretty long line every single morning. Unless you want to wait for 30 minutes or more for a meal, just call ahead, place your order, and your food is ready in 10 minutes. There are tables right next to the restaurant so it's not like you are losing the great view. If you are looking to partake in some activities I highly recommend going to the Expedia Concierge in the lobby. Eden helped us out and planned a helicopter trip and a whale watching expedition (although we couldn't go on the whale boat because my wife is 6 months pregnant and the limit is 3 months). She was great and very helpful. Other than that, I recommend Maui Tacos in Lahaina, it's very good. Also Kimo's and Moose McGillicudy's for those that have never been in the area. Oh yea, and the Sea House which is at Napili Kai (right across the beach) has awesome pupu's and cocktails. Hope you enjoy as much as we did, say hi to the turtles for me....

Reviews.Title: “Great place but alittle out of the way”
Reviews.Author: worldtravler117
Reviews.Content: Found our second floor room to be very comfortable. We were worried about no air conditioning but it was never a problem. The room always cooled off enough so sleeping was fine. We enjoyed the Gazebo Restaurant, and our first morning there, as we walked down to have breakfast, we saw a couple of whales jump. Great way to start a vacation. Most morning as we enjoyed a free cup of coffee we would see whales. The other restaurant on site also had good food. The Napili Market is very close, so picking food for the room is not a problem. Snorkeling in Napili Bay was not very good, would recommend the next bay to the north or drive to Mile Marker 14.

Reviews.Title: “January '11 guests beware”
Reviews.Author: mkb0507
Reviews.Content: Many first floor units were flooded in recent storm. Our second floor ocean front was lovely, but having witnesses the clean up in the units below us, I would not want to stay in them. The carpets were soaked with rain and storm drain run of (muddy with the Maui red dirt). The other thing to know is that the property is in the midst of major roof work (independent of the storm). During the week, workers were on our roof starting at 8 and lasting most of the day. The work was loud but the workers were even louder, shouting to each other from the various roof tops. We woke to one calling out "patch the rat holes while you're up there." Yes, I know it's the tropics and these things are unavoidable but a little discretion would help! All said, we would come back here. It's a terrific beach and the hotels is (usually) comfortable and a god value.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: raid2light
Reviews.Content: We stayed a first week in January in Napili Shores. We enjoyed a free upgrade to a ocean view room and a free yummy pineapple. Also staff and manager were very friendly and they did accommodate our requests quickly. Hotel itself is located very close to beautiful Napili Beach. Having said that, there were few issues that spoiled the fun. Unfortunately the least waves and best snorkeling on Napili beach appears to be to the very right end of the beach and there there is no pedestrian pathway around the beach - this meant walking in ankle deed sand entire length of the beach and back every day - not fun at all! Also the road next to hotel has no pedestrian pathway, and unless you have a rental car at your disposal at all times the road itself is not pedestrian friendly (it's downright dangerous to walk due to razor sharp curves and no pedestrian walkway). Hotel itself is very quiet so don't expect any night life. There is not much to see or do on the property itself. It does not have a gym, which would be a nice addition. It does not have air conditioning but there was plenty of trade winds that kept us cool during our stay. Hotel has two pools which were clean and well kept. Hotel has internet access which was broken in our room and staff referred us to outside provider for help (which was not very helpful). Overall it's a good hotel in excellent location, but beware of the access to the beach and lack of pedestrian pathway around the beach or even to the other hotels. We rented before in Kahana and found this to be less expensive and more fun than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: edisonppig
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel beside the Napili bay, two minutes walking without crowd. Two nice restaurants in this hotel. You even do not have to rent a car. The bus stop is located at the entrance of the hotel. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalislandradio
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times with our kids, as they grow we have "outgrown" the rooms as the suites are a bit small, but great ocean views and 2 nice pools. Staff is very friendly and Gazebo restaraunt is a must. We like that this is north of the fast-paced and crowded Lahaina and Kaanapalli, the Napili small town atmosphere is private and mellow. A hidden jem! - Tropical Island Radio

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: muscheline
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade to an ocean front room and the view was great.Sitting on our lanai everyday was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful quiet hidaway”
Reviews.Author: HIgirl84
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous place to stay! Close to the beaches and downtown area, but without all the hussle and bussle of a large resort. Such a quiet and quaint place to stay. We got a yummy pinapple at check in, along with a free upgrade to a ocean view room! The line at the Gazebo was long, but worth it if you're craving omlettes and pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: mfranfam
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th time staying here in 15 years. We have stayed other places on the island, and this is, hands down, our favorite. The location is a bit far from most "tourist" sites, so if you have never been to Maui, you may not want to consider this spot. The accommodations are not 5 star. Housekeeping is not daily, and if you feel you need air conditioning, this is not your spot. All that said, the rooms are very comfortable, the grounds beautiful, the beach perfect, the Gazebo dining is the best breakfast on the island. The staff is friendly and you don't have to dress up to walk through the lobby. There is a do it yourself laundry room on site. After this last visit, I think we all decided that this is the only place we will ever stay on Maui for now on.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: getmeout69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Napili Shores outrigger 4 times now and love it. We find the relaxing atmosphere exactly what we are looking for in a holiday. We recommend renting a car as it is a drive to most of the things of interest or even just a grocery store. There can be big differences in room quality as some rooms are private owned and some are just part of the hotel. We have always used the private owned ones and always had good luck. The gazebo is a nice place to eat at Napili Shores and is always very busy. A regular tip for people that stay at the Outrigger is to order your food and then pick it up and eat in your room. The only difficulty we had was when we arrived after midnight due to flight delays and there was no one at the front desk. We were unsure as to what to do and just randomly picked up the security phone. Thankfully we were able to get into our room. Not a great way to start a holiday. The rest of the stay was great however and we would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Manatee355
Reviews.Content: we had the most amazing family vacation at the Napili shores. Location was brilliant, easy access to the beach and the pools were always super clean and not crowded. The room was wonderful and the front desk was very helpful with all our requests during our two week stay.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: JennyJuice
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel. The room was huge witha big kitchen. Outside there were two pools (including jacuzzi). The hotel is directly at the waterfront, with access to the beach and as soon as the sunset begins everybody meets to watch the sunset. Just next to the beach is a little bay where you can go snorkeling with turtles. The hotel is a bit far from the bigger city Lahaina but there is the bus that takes you all the way there (just ask at the receiption) All in all the service was awesome and I highly recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to relax! Thanks for this great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly sevice, clean & comfortable rooms, good location, good rates”
Reviews.Author: medwordsmith
Reviews.Content: Stay here; you won't be disappointed. Beach is nice - good snorkel areas nearby. Gazebo restaurant has wonderful breakfast fare. Staff and guests are all extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE IN WEST MAUI”
Reviews.Author: twhbandit
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to Hawaii and we loved this resort......beautiful grounds, ocean view studio ( slept everynight comfortably with the tradewinds blowing thru out sliding door open to awaken to the view of Molikai and the ocean) Hands down the best beach on maui and the Gazebo was wonderful( hint....call and have you food in 10 minutes and enjoy a quiet meal from your private lanai) 2 pools and never crowded. Join in with other guest and bring your wine and appetizers to the wall at the oceanview pool for the sunset every evening. Lots of sea turtles at the rocks around the resort. We checked out South Maui and Kanappali Resort areas and were so thrilled that we chose this resort......If you are looking for crowds and busy pools and beaches this is not for you We would not stay anywhere else on Maui

Reviews.Title: “No words!! Just incredible!!”
Reviews.Author: Christine1967
Reviews.Content: Have been to Maui three times,and this was our first time at this 'hotel'. Absolutely the best~can hardly call it a 'hotel' though. There are only two levels, and the property is well maintained. There are bbqs,two pools, and u can access a 'private' beach within walking distance-you can see sea turtles from the shore. Very clean, open, studio-type room. There is no a/c, which wouldnt be a problem, but you have to sleep with the windows open, and the birds like to be up and chatting at 0530! But thats what its all about!! Take advantage of the call ahead service for guests at the Gazebo restaurant--my mouth is still watering over the Macadamia Nut Pancakes with coconut syrup! You can also stay an extra 3 hrs after normal checkout time if available for only $25.

Reviews.Title: “Would LOVE to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: rvalenzuela
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Gave us a complimentary Maui Gold Pineapple and eco-friendly travel tote upon check-in - Comfortable King-size bed and a twin-size pull out bed - Fully-stocked kitchen with dishwasher, granite countertops, and a full-size refrigerator - Spacious bathroom with a shower big enough for 2 people and a quality shower head - Clean room overall; Maid service every 3rd day allows for more privacy and less frequent tips - Flat screen plasma TV - Convenient balcony/ patio attached to every room - 2 heated pools, 1 jacuzzi tub - Access to Napili Bay- BEAUTIFUL beach good for swimming and snorkeling - FREE parking - No need to wait for breakfast at the Gazebo (Maui's best breakfast restaurant); just call in an order and it'll be ready for pick-up in 10 minutes! - Location is close to Napili Plaza: grocery store, coffee shop, fast food restaurants - Friendly front desk - Great value (booked it as a package on priceline.com; estimate less than $85 per night!) Cons: - For those who prefer air conditioning, the 2 ceiling fans and an open balcony/ patio sliding door may not be enough

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Beachcomber10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July. We had a so-called ocean view room and then moved to a ocean front room. We did not feel that the ocean view room actually had a view of the ocean. We could see a small amount of ocean if we sat in a corner of the living room. On the other hand the ocean front room ($15.00 more per night) had a beautiful view of Napili Bay. Everything about the room was perfect. The kitchen was outstanding, especially compared to hotels we stayed at in Oahu and Kauai. The only negative was one of the people at the desk. She was unfriendly and rude. If not for here I would have rated this hotel as 5/5. On the on the other hand, the reservations person, Lenora, could not have been more helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VACATION”
Reviews.Author: laurenmiller85
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort! I had read the reviews on the resort and tried to keep up with the most resent ones up unti it was time for my trip and I was not dissapointed. The place was just like the majority said about it. It was clean and what we asked for and wanted. I have heard before when you ask for a "Ocean view" room the view you get is a tiny little glimpse of the ocean as you lean all the way over your balcony...but not with this place. I could clearly see the ocean right from my room. We didnt need A/C..the breeze was perfect. We had wonderful snorkeling right next to us at the "turtle cove" as it seems to be known. We got amazing photos as well! Everything was amazing. We were only a 2 mintute drive so other great beaches. The place was nice and quiet. There were times when we had the pool(the one located towards the lobby) all the ourselves! THe only thing I would complain about is the lobby restaurant at the hotel. We made the mistake of going there one night for dinner and it was awful! The food was over cooked and expensive. I paid $15 for a burnt burger! If you go into Lahaina you can get normal food prices! Other then that the place was great and i would recommend it to anyone. We were there for our wedding anniversary and it was perfect! :-)

Reviews.Title: “I was so impressed with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hthr001
Reviews.Content: I went to Hawaii and stayed 3 days in Oahu and 4 days in Maui. After checking in at Napili Shores Resort, I wished I had spent the whole vacation there. Although the reviews were good, this is one of the cheaper hotels in the area so I honestly didn't expect it to be as nice as it is. It's about 20 minutes away from the shopping/dinning strip, which provides for a more intimate and tranquil setting. The one bedroom unit we had was BEAUTIFUL with plenty of room for the three of us. It's been updated all the way through with granite counters, plantation shutters and a flat screen television. As I watched the sunset, I was in awe of the paradise around me! The beach has an area of lava rocks with little black crabs and fish which my kids loved exploring! The only draw backs were the ridiculously over priced dinner restaurant (the poolside restaurant was great for breakfast or lunch), and every morning they seemed to weed eat or use their walkie-talkies right outside my window. Not being able to wake at my own leisure got really annoying! Check a map when setting your GPS because mine was set for shortest route and directed us to Hwy. 340 instead of 380 which was 24 miles of insanity!!! An adventure to say the least, but there is a nice 4 lane highway that is soooo much easier!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, peaceful, quiet, turtles... ! What more could you want!”
Reviews.Author: sushipopstar
Reviews.Content: We have been on the island 4 times... this, by far, has been the best hotel we've stayed at! Let's start with the staff, amazing they all made you feel like "ohona", they were on top of every request we had... while being friendly! Room cleaning was every 3 days (including towels)... but we requested that our towels be changed daily, and they did! Beach towels are also available at the front desk and are changed when ever you ask. The rooms were great! We stayed in a partial ocean view garden room (we were upgraded, originally booked as a garden view room). Our room had everything we could possibly need, our only complaint was the bed (one person in our party had a bad back), it could have been more comfortable... worth suffering through! We were right next to the recycle... totally quiet no noise what so ever, we woke up to the birds chirpping every morning! The Gazebo... so worth it, we suggest the macadamia nut pancakes and fried rice! We didn't go to the Aloha Grill... it looked delicous but more of a dress-up expensive place. Food wise we would suggest the farmer's market... and if you like salad, Round Table, had a delicous fresh salad bar way cheaper than the grocery store! There are two pools we suggest the heated... (next to the main office) the ocean-side pool is nice but... brrrrrr! As for the beach it is amazing, the beach looks just like the pictures so nice... this hotel is on the windier side of the island... but that just makes for a nice afternoon! If you go to the beach around 4:00 p.m. there are tons of turtles right outside of the hotel... it's like a dream! I could go on and on more than I already have but you just have to go there and see for your self! I hope you have a great vacation just like we did! I LOVE this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Saved the Day”
Reviews.Author: MauiFan21
Reviews.Content: We were forced to leave our first choice hotel due to an extremely rowdy and loud family that had booked several rooms. After 3 nights, we gave up and spent the 4th morning of our trip looking for somewhere else to stay. The folks at Napili Shores came to our rescue with an oceanfront studio. Clean, comfortable, and right on the beach. And did I say, "QUIET"? The staff is great, invisible until you needed them. They also offered a hospitality suite to use on our last day since we were on a red-eye, this is a great perk. We never did go to the Gazebo restaurant as the lines were always crazy long - we thought they might be giving away breakfast to draw such crowds each day. Our one suggestion would be to change the hours of sprinkler operation - 4:00 am is a little early and they are noisy. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: SparkysDad
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maui and my wie's second. Our son who lived on Oahu recommended we stay at Napili Bay. We took his advice and are we glad we did. We did not rent from the resort but through a private owner. But this review is about the resort and not the rooms. The resort was fantastic. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The resort grounds were manicured to perfection. Everything was cleaned cleaned daily. The Gazebo restaurant offered good food and reasonable prices. The suggestion to call in for carry out was a great one. Rather than stand in line, which did move quickly, we would call and order and have our food within 10 minutes which we then ate while sitting over looking the bay from our condo One thing that could be improved is beach access. The trek to the sand is through lava rock and for the elderly might be difficult. Other than that, we were quite happy with our selection. During our stay, we did tour the other resorts on the bay and in our opinion, the Outrigger Napili Shores was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Vasuki1
Reviews.Content: Excellent condo - great bed, kitchenette, pool, beach, garden, cleanliness. Room size average. Location very quiet and private, in the best part of western Maui. Excellent breakfast cafe on site, but evening meals no good for vegetarians, as we are (Lahaina not far away though). Highly recommended for a quiet stay of good quality. No night life.

Reviews.Title: “Eight wonderful nights spent at Outrigger Napili Shores.”
Reviews.Author: m1a1fan
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in three years my Wife and I have taken a trip to Hawaii (we've been to Kauai, "The Big Island" and now Maui) and also the third time we've stayed at an Outrigger Condo. We've had really good luck with Outrigger and Napili Shores was no different. FYI, Napili Shores is a bit further north on the Island than Lahaina or Ka'anapali but the drive never took more than about 30 minutes to get down to Lahaina. I'd say the extra bit of driving was worth it. We stayed in an Ocean View Studio (Room 213 on the 2nd floor) which had a very nice view of the Ocean and Molokai and made for some beautiful sunset views right from our balcony. The check in process was quick and easy and we were given a Green Tote Bag, Beach Towels and a Pineapple to enjoy in our room. Staff at the front desk were always friendly and approachable. There is a keyless (enter you're own four digit code) Safe in the room in which to place you're valuables. Housekeeping comes every three days unless you make a request to have them come more often. The room itself was clean and recently updated / modernized and gave a feel of a more expensive room than we had. Complementary High Speed Internet is also provided in the room. Laundry facilities (coin operated) are available here as well which appeals to my Wife and I since we like to "pack light" for our vacations. The Kitchen was fully stocked with Silverware, plates, pots and pans, etc... which was nice as we enjoy cooking a few meals at home to save money. A Coffee maker was also in the room though the provided coffee left much to be desired. Stop by MauiGrown Coffee Company (off of Lahainaluna Rd.) and get yourself a bag of the real stuff grown on Maui. The Queen Bed was it's usual spongy / springy self. We did get a decent night's sleep on it though but coming from a Tempur-Pedic back home it's hard to compare anything to that. There are two swimming pools on the property (one with a hot tub) but we never used either one so I can't comment on that. We had no problem with parking around the resort (Napili Shores doesn't charge extra for parking like some other Resorts). The Gazebo Restaurant down by the ocean is open for Breakfast / Lunch from 7:30am-2pm and people from all around the area line up early for their food. The only issue you may have concerning parking is if you leave and come back during Breakfast Hours. Speaking of the Gazebo Restaurant, you can avoid the long wait in line if you stay here at Napili Shores. Just phone in you're order after 8am, walk down and pick it up, come back to you're room and watch everyone else stand in line while you're eating a very good Breakfast. The Maui Grill (also on the property) has a nice Dinner selection and opens at 4:30pm. We ate here on our first and last night on the Island. "People Noise" was never an issue for us. You will get people (non residents of Napili Shores) heading down to the Gazebo for Breakfast starting around 7am but they were for the most part respectful of the "quiet hours" posted around the grounds. Which leads me to my next point. Napili Shores does appeal to and draws many families with small Children (some unruly and noisy). If for some reason this bothers you or you're in the market for absolute peace and quiet you may want to look elsewhere. There is no sandy Beach in front of Napili Shores. My wife and I did enjoy walking out on the rocky shoreline and watching the small sea life that live in the small pools of the rocky shoreline. There is a nice sandy beach to the right of Napili shores that one can very easily walk to and enjoy a day in the sun. Like most of the Hawaiian Islands we've been to, it does occasionally rain but it's usually brief and a warm rain at that. Don't let it disrupt you're activities. Overall, we had a wonderful stay here at Napili shores and would return when / if we return to Maui. I highly recommend it. Feel free to email with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation of My Whole LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: ams012010
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin. I went to Napili Shores with my family four years ago. This was my first time i had ever been to Maui and my first time staying in condos for vacation. I was completely excited. When we got there me and my sister were a little worried. The place was very very quiet not a lot of excitement I was expecting a lot more. However! The garden view room.. was beautiful. This was before they remodeled. The grounds.. GORGEOUS. Everything was clean and just amazing. My mom booked a room at the Westin for one night because they had a really nice pool and water slide. We checked in and an hour later we checked out and got our money back. We went straight back to Napili shores for the rest of the vacation. The staff is amazing and so welcoming, everything is clean, the kitchen the beds were COMFORTABLE. I loved waking up to the birds and you can hear the ocean. Another thing i thought was very unique is the Gazebo. I really thought it was cool how popular it was. Plus they make the best breakfast ever. Now i'm graduating this year and we leave July 28th 2010 to go back! Its all i think about and i cant wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: teseason
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many other properties on Maui and this one is just such a great value it's hard to think of going anywhere else. At $165 per night for ocean view, it's a great deal. We found ocean front a bit noisy with the waves crashing on the rocks, so the ocean view from the second level in buildings G or B are the way to go. Service is friendly, the grounds are well tended, and the sunsets every night are beautiful. It's not super fancy, but clean and well kept. Rent through the Outrigger for the updated rooms, others may be cheaper but are a mixed bag from what I can tell. If you want more activity stay at Kaanapali or in Lahaina. Napili Bay is very laid back, with no hotels over 2 stories. Very relaxing, but also just a short car ride to Kahana, Kaanapali or Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!”
Reviews.Author: OsmarBsb
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel !! I stayed in an Oceanfront Studio, complete with all kinds of kitchen equipment. Spacious but cozy room, beautiful view, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. Seems like the place has been recently thoroughly refurbished. Spotless gardens, nice swimming pool (though I didn't went there). Expedia people were awesome (thanks, Eden !!). And a plus is the Gazebo restaurant with VIP service for hotel guests (we just ordered by phone and picked up those tasty pancakes 10 minutes later, no staying in lines whatsoever). In sum, perfect service, perfect room, perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a good for all seasons family friendly delight”
Reviews.Author: doddsnarrows
