Reviews.Content: we have returned to napili shores for over 25 years and have always enjoyed the spaciousness and options it offers. there are no bad rooms and a choice of two good pools or the beach. napili bay is walk-on and kapalua and honolua within easy reach and if you snorkel around the south point of napili bay you are in a rockier bay home to many sea turtles, you can also walk there. good restaurants and tennis are nearby and the staff are very helpful and friendly. i would especially recommend walking down the beach to the sea house restaurant at the napili kai resort for breakfast, drop-in tennis at the kapalua tennis club, lunch at the pineapple grill at kapalua and happy hour at the aloha mixed plate in lahaina from 3-6. very good value for the money and great for either a short or extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaOmro
Reviews.Content: This resort was the best! Very clean and so convenient with the refrigerator, microwave, full stove and even a dishwasher. We snorkeled off the beach next door and saw several different kinds of fish in the coral, we rented the fins and snorkel equipment from Boss Frog's, just a few minutes drive from the resort (next to the grocery store). It was a great place to stay in a wonderful location on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: Sheena C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of March. It suited us as was on a quiet bay and away from the main resorts. The studios were large and very well equipped. There is an excellent supermarket just up the road and great coffe place and internet there too. Watching the sun go down is a ritual where guests take drinks and nibbles so quite sociable. The restaurant had just reopened and had no licence but there is a general store 3 minutes walk to buy wine. Staff very helpful about this. The Gazebo restaurant is meant to be great for breakfast but never got there due to the long line waiting for pancakes. The only downside was the concierge. The activities desk is run by Expedia and offers coffee and pastries on first day to orientate guests and assist to book trips. The one we got appeared put out that we wanted the information. There was another family who attended and she was rude to them too. Her manner was hostile and patronizing and I wonder why she was in a job like that. We booked one trip which was sold to us almost begrudgingly and found it is easier and cheaper to book in the large resort areas. This would be a lovely place to stay with a family too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value ,excellent beach!”
Reviews.Author: Nascent_Explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Apr 1st to 5th 2010.When we landed we were surpirsed to get a free oceanfront upgrade.That got us on an excellent start for our Maui stay.I had read reviews from others here that we can see humpback whales right from our beach facing balcony. And guess what -we witnessed couple of whales playing with each other in the ocean.Note -(Whales only from nov to May).So we rushed to the beach to get a good view with the binoculars and very very excited.The front desk staff was extremely friendly and the the local expedia represetative who sits right near the front desk was very resourceful and gave us an excellent deal on a dolphin watch-snorkeling-b-fast-bbq lunch combo thru the pacific whale foundation. Overall experience was very good. they hv free parking and bbq facility next to the pool .Only -ve is it rains a lot in Napili area.

Reviews.Title: “A great value find on a great beach”
Reviews.Author: Vinifico
Reviews.Content: We kind of stumbled on this and were glad we did. We spent a week here last year. It's very quiet, roomy, comfortable and on one of the best beaches on the south side of Maui. The room was clean and had been updated with an LCD TV. The full kitchen made it easy for us to prepare a couple of meals and relax on the deck. I'd recommend this place to just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Maui”
Reviews.Author: NeelaAmber
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at the hotel. The hotel has 2 pools in the middle--one by the ocean, one hot tub. The hotel is by the ocean though right "below" the hotel is rocky beach. The sandy beaches are a little walk--2 minutes away! As the buildings are only 2-stories tall parking is close to the rooms. The hotel is definitely family friendly with the full kitchen in the room, grills by the pool, pools, and just the overall ambiance. We paid $135 per night and at that rate the hotel is a good buy. The grocery store and restaurants are a drive away (not right on any strip) but if you are in Maui you likely already have a car. The room felt up-to-date. We did have a couple of minor issues. The deck sliding door did not work. The shower drain did not drain properly. I brought it up to the front-desk's attention but nobody ever came to address these issues. The hotel by default only cleans the rooms every 3 days. I had asked for daily service but nobody showed up for the first day. These were minor inconveniences but they do impact your vacation experience. The concierge / activity planning desk hosted by Expedia was helpful. Pricing for the activities was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and low key property in a greay location.”
Reviews.Author: paulharr
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights here in an ocean view room watching whales from our patio, cooking out in the central lawn areas and watching kids play on the lawn areas. Good jumping off spot for Lahaina activities like whale viewing boat trips, snorkel boats and fine dining when not cooking at resort. A spot for those not prefering high-rise sophistication and commercialism of Kaanapali, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of everything”
Reviews.Author: timmytichi
Reviews.Content: We stayed hee for 8 nights and found everything just great. It is not fancy but everthing was fresh, clean and recently refurbished. We had an ocean view which was great for sitting on the deck and watching the whales swim by. I think this resort is family friendly. Just because your kids can't go in the hot tub doesn't make it not a good place for kids. We loved watching the kids play on the green and likely if people were getting stares it was because their kids were badly behaved. This resort is quiet and I much prefered it to the hotel after hotel 15 stories high in the other areas. beach was very nice, although a bit narrow when the waves were high. Very good snorkleing right off the beach, which although not right at the resort was only 20 feet down a path. Great deal, great place, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugOC
Reviews.Content: WHATS NOT TO LOVE ABOUT MAUI? This wasour first time to the islands, we came for our 20th anniversary and would definately stay at napili shores again!!t the only thing that we would change would be to spend the little extra and get the ocean view. garden view was fine but it would have had that little extra romance to sit out on the lanai drinking a mai tai watching those fabulous sunsets every night ;) house keeping comes every 3 days, it worked out just fine for us but if you need more towels you just have to ask:) the staff was friendly and helpful with anything we needed. The grounds are well kept and just beautiful. there is a grocery store just down the road we took advantage of the kitchen we had breakfast every morning in our room and snacks on hand in the evenings when we returned. for newBee's to this wonderful state our stay here was more than we could have hoped for!! we would stay here again and again!!! ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Weâ€™ll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: gbsask
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were surprised by an upgrade to a suite; which was very clean and spacious. There was no air-conditioning in our room, but we stayed in Maui when the weather was windy, overcast and cool, so we didnâ€™t miss the air conditioning. The dishes, furniture and bedding were in good shape. Thereâ€™s also free parking and a free in-room safe. In one of the drawers, thereâ€™s a guest book where you can leave your thoughts to the condo owner. Nice touch. On the property there are 2 pools, and a hot tub. The hot tub was roped off for a day for repair, but it was returned to service the next day. There are two restaurants on the property, but we don' know what they are like. The Gazebo restaurant always had long lines, so we didnâ€™t bother waiting around. The other restaurant on the property had high prices on the menu, so we never went in. Lasting impressions? The resort seems to be more of a Family oriented place than a Couples resort or a â€œSpring Breakâ€� place. Itâ€™s a clean place and the front desk, housekeeping and grounds keeping staff are excellent. Weâ€™ll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT KID FRIENDLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo9596
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort as many reviews stated this resort was kid friendly.The kids we have meet are friendly, but the older bluehaired people are NOT! KIds are not allowed in the only hot tub on the premise which is located next to one of the pools. We( parents and kids ) were given dirty looks and glares if the kids showed any signs of having fun....ie being kids. The bbq area gets policed by the regulars and they don't give up much bbq space easly. Kids are told to "Keep It Down" at 5pm at night.,,,as the older folk are napping!The Maui Grill restaurant is not bad...no liquor license thou. Laundry room is clean and up to date! The front desk and expdeia staff are very helpful and friendly. The beaches are fabulous.The resort is great if you are traveling without kids,but enjoy kids trying to have fun around you.....less hassel as you won't have to be bad cop to your own kids on vacation

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our family”
Reviews.Author: giramondo96
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Napili Shores and we had a great experience for the four days we were on Maui. The front desk was friendly and efficient. While checking in they provided beach towels, reusable shopping bag and they even gave my son a little kiddie backpack with binoculars, sunglasses and notebook which was a nice touch. This welcome set the tone for our visit. This is a very family-oriented place, there were a lot of families out on the grounds and at the pool which was to our liking. There were two pools (one of them had a hot tub) and Napili beach is right there. Not far away is Kapalua where there is another beautiful beach. The condo itself was very clean and updated. It looks like it was redone recently. There was a flat screen tv, free in room wireless internet, ceiling fan (no a/c), microwave, full size fridge, coffee maker, toaster, eating utensils and cooking utensils. There was maid service every three days. Parking was never a problem and there are two restaurants on-site. The Gazebo Restaurant is located at the pool and has an ocean view which is a popular place for breakfast, if you're hungry make sure you get there early because there was always a line . We were there during whale season and we could see whales from the pool which was really cool. If I had to give the cons about staying here that may be a problem for others but not for us I would say: 1) there's no a/c and if it was really hot or there wasn't much of a breeze it could be uncomfortable 2) if you want to stay at a place where you have a lot of privacy, this place might not suit you because as I said there were lots families with younger and older kids that spent a lot of time outside on the grounds (eg. playing ball, hanging out at the pool or on their lanai) 3) I wouldn't consider this a central location on the island. It is very close to Kanapali and Lahaina and it doesn't take long to get to these two areas, but for example if you want to go to South Maui it would take longer since you are all the way up north of Lahaina especially since the traffic can be bad. When we were staying there, there was road construction so it took a little while to get around. We have been to Maui a number of times before and spent time down in Kihei and Wailea so we didn't go down in that area this trip. We stopped off on the way to the hotel at the supermarket in Lahaina got our supplies and then pretty much stayed in this area This was a great place for us and we plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Return after 15 years and it was even better”
Reviews.Author: Joewashington
Reviews.Content: After 15 years we returned to Napili Shores. It is low key, quiet with nice accomodations. Everything worked well; staff and other visitors friendly. Room very nice as a studio apartment. Nice to grill out with others. Pancakes at the Gazebo were great even though the entire island wanted to come there. Both pools nice. Beach is great, but you can walk to 2 even better beaches. You can also walk to several other places to dine as well as a grocery store and 2 general stores, one with great breakfasts and lunches. What more could you want? Room service and a poolside bar? This is not the place for you. Birds waking you up in the morning; this is your place. NO elevators?;sign up today.

Reviews.Title: “Great Studios...”
Reviews.Author: carifay
Reviews.Content: Great studio apartments, own kitchen. With BBQ pits outside... Great breakfast place serving every kind of pancake you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: olsonslovetravel
Reviews.Content: Napili Bay is a beautiful spot and Napili Shores is a great little find. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped. The resort has two pools and a hot tub. The Gazebo Restaurant over looking the water offers wonderful breakfasts and lunches. Avoid the line-ups and order take-out. The new Maui Grill is a welcome addition to the Napili restaurant scene. We had two memorable dinners there and plan to go back for more. Owner Fred really out does himself to make you happy. The Ahi Poke Tower is not to be missed, both beautiful in presentation and delicious. They are still waiting for their liquor license so we were told when we checked in to the resort that we could bring our own wine, which we did. Other restaurants to try include The Sea House, the best fish tacos, and Merriman's, whose menu is amazing and who make the best Mai Tai on the island, and believe me my husband has tried them all. Be sure to make it to Merriman's for happy hour on their unbelievable patio, which includes the best view, lounge chairs and even a fire pit.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Sarmatian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the best beach in Maui. This sounds incredible, by my son and I snorkeled with a sea turtle! The beach had it all: a fantastic view of Molokai, wonderful snorkeling, tide pools to wander in, and in the afternoon we could boogie board there. Right next door is Kapalua beach which to my mind is the second nicest beach on Maui. Our room was completely refurbished with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances and it was absolutely immaculate. A fantastic value, an absolutely superb location to give my family the trip of a lifetime. We will DEFINITELY come back again. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking scenery”
Reviews.Author: Serenitee
Reviews.Content: The trip from the airport to Napili Shores is about 45 mins of the most spectacular scenery I've ever seen. Or so I thought until I saw the rest of the island. WOW! Take time to explore if you like lush green tropical gardens, cascading waterfalls, golden sandy beaches, abundant colorful fish and turtles, lots of whales, and unforgettable sunsets. We drove around most of the island in 7 days but not enough time to see everything. The Old Lahaina Luau is worth the expense as the food and dancers are the best on the island. Definately go snorkleing at Molokini and Turtle beach. Big Beach has miles of soft golden sand . The surf is a little strong in March depending on the weather but still lots of opportunity to swim and snorkle. We saw lots of people surfing too. The Outrigger Napili Shores was perfect for us. We had a 1 bedroom with a view of the pool on the ground floor. I loved having our own private patio just steps away from the pool and Gazebo restaurant. The 1 bedroom was roomy and comfortable for a couple with 2 teenagers. Everything we needed was there. We took advantage of the barbeques to cook our dinner when we weren't eating out . The Gazebo serves breakfast and lunch and are known for their delicious Macadamia Nut pancakes. People line up for them every morning and they're worth it. The staff there are helpful and extremely friendly. Would love to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: O2Bquilting
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good place to stay, as long as you're not looking for a four/five star hotel. Clean, comfortable bed. Having a kitchen was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: gilbertconstruction
Reviews.Content: Evening front desk help "Bobby" very good.Thanks for the service and care. Housekeeping "Reve" works so hard and oustanding job. These two stood out though all seemed good.Always smiles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Too Many Noisy Children & Terrible Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mauiwonderland
Reviews.Content: Aloha! My husband & I have lived on Maui for almost 10 years now & have stayed at numerous condos & hotels on the island. We took some time off work & stayed at Napili Shores for 2 nights. Rooms were nice and clean but had no ac and less than efficient fans. Their was little to no interaction with the staff, they never seem to be around. So windows are usually kept open so breezes can come through which brings all the noises of outside right inside. There were too many screaming kids at any time of the day...early morning, mid-day, when you are trying to take a nap & wee into later hours. That really killed the romance factor. Relaxing by the pool (and there are 2 pools) was also impossible as there were children taking up the entire pool, screeching & parents in their own worlds ignoring them. And this is why we tried to pick a "quiet, couples atmosphere" type of condo. The Gazebo restaurant is FANTASTIC & the highlight of staying there other than Napili Bay Beach which is lovely. Long wait line, but that's what happens when both tourists & locals know a great deal on a wonderful breakfast or lunch. If you want to eat in your room or lanai, call ahead and take your food to go.....avoid the lines! Nobody seems to remember that! HOWEVER the other restaurant that serves dinner on the property was one of the worst experiences we've ever had on Maui. There were only 4 tables of diners when we arrived. We were not greeted for about 10 minutes when we walked in. There appeared to be 1 VERY GRUMPY waitress handling all tables who didn't even acknowledge us. When we were finally seated she threw menus at us, offered no explainations of specials or options. Waited another 15 minutes for drinks while looking at the terrible menu selection & rip-off prices. And we don't mind paying alot for a spectacular dinner....this is where we should have just walked out. BUT we ordered a salad (awful) and 2 entrees staek & fish. It took almost an hour to get the food, no apologies & everything was tasteless & bland. We were downright upset! Waitress never checked on us, and never said goodnight when we left. With all the great spots to eat on Maui, DO NOT CHANCE IT!!!!!! We will only be back to eat breakfast at The Gazebo.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Peacefulyogi
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The 1 bedroom unit was clean. The bed was awesome, the kitchen had everything you needed plus more. The laundry facility was huge and very affordable. Having two pools and a beach only a few yards away was wonderful. The barbecues were always available and clean. The value was way beyond our expectations. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a family”
Reviews.Author: snicklefritzy
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo here privately and got a really good deal. The only thing we couldn't get was the towel service but everything else was the same. We stayed in a unit right in front of the upper pool called the E units and it was great. The kids could go in and out to the pool as much as they wanted, we often cooked our meals at the BBQ's. The beach at Napili Shores is beautiful, we had a great time boogie boarding, body surfing and snorkeling. We often did day trips to places like Kihae, Hana and north of Napili. We also made lots of trips to Lahaina which was convenient for grocery items and wandering around the town. I did notice that some days when it was lightly raining at Napili is was dry in Lahaina and south. I think it is a tiny bit wetter here than south of Napili but the rain was usually short lived.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise....pretty darn close!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceVictoria
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th stay at Napili Shores. We love the grounds, the beach, the views and couldn't complain about our room either. The only thing we didn't like like the reviewer below was the noise of inconsiderate people putting their recycling out before 8 in the morning. I even went up to the office to ask them if perhaps they could put a sign up there or in each of the units asking people to please use the recycling from 9am to 6pm but she said there were enough signs about other things and she didn't want more signs around the property. I walked around the parking lots and there is a recycling centre up at the front where no units are but then there are recyling centres on the sleeping side of first half of C block and first half of H block. I wouldn't stay in any of those rooms again until Napili Shores mgt and private owners have rectified this awful problem...how awful? One morning I was awakened to breaking glass at 6:15 and then again at 6:45! And yes as the person below said babies cry and you can hear them the walls aren't that thick but I just felt sorry for the families and put my earplugs in. If you have booked this resort in any other blocks you will have one of the most wonderful holidays of your life, the sunsets at the wall are heaven themselves. It is a very low key resort which is so refreshing from the highrise hotels. Very quiet not a 'happening' place you have to go to Kaanapali or Lahaina for night fun but boy you can't beat Napili Bay for swimming and when calm the snorkelling is fine.....don't forget to go to the bay to the left of Napili to watch the turtles.....if you go in the winter months swim booties are an asset getting in and out of Turtle Bay. Any questions feel free to email me Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: sugarandspice5661
Reviews.Content: This place was clean ,updated, friendly, I felt like I was at home. We swam with the turtles for free everyday outside our room. We snorkeled everyday right outside our room. I watched the whales jump out of the water every morning. We had the best breakfast around the area on the property. Now you know why I say WOW!!!!! We will be back for a second honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Shores review”
Reviews.Author: dbellpfb
Reviews.Content: We had a real nice time other then the week we went was exceptionally humid and muggy and the trades winds where non-existent. Without AC it made it a bit hard to sleep at night. We would go back but as luck had it also 6 of the 7 days we were there a 3 year girl cried almost every waking hour she was up despite the valent attemps of two grandmothers and a mother to appise the little darling.....We still had fun and most likely will go back but will check around a bit and AC would have been nice at night.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait till next year....”
Reviews.Author: FizzieOne
Reviews.Content: After our flight was canceled two days before departure, Napili Shores was very helpful in booking us another night to accomodate a new departure date. Our room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the sound of the waves from the lanai was perfect. We had an oceanfront condo that had a well stocked kitchen, books to read, and a piano. We didn't mind not having A/C. The ceiling fan did a great job with the lanai door open and the front door open a bit. It made a wonderful breeze thru the room. I enjoyed sitting on the lawn each evening with neighbors to watch the sunset. The macadamia nut pancakes from the Gazebo are great....but do use the speed dial on the room phone for pick-up yourself. Much faster. We aren't too fussy about room service so the every third day didn't bother us, even though they seemed to pop in sooner. We cooked most of our own meals and ate on the lanai...what a view. We enjoyed the entire two weeks and are looking forward to next year already.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Beach”
Reviews.Author: littleones28
Reviews.Content: Pros - Very convenient to the beach. Great on-site place for breakfast. No problems with parking. Cons - No a/c however it wasn't hot because there was a great breeze. Since we left the windows open at night. the sprinklers went on every morning at 4AM and woke us up!

Reviews.Title: “A great value.”
Reviews.Author: journeysfarandnear
Reviews.Content: This low-key Hawaiian spirited resort (3-4* depending on who's rating it) condominium with 2 restaurants and hotel services provided a wonderful relaxing vacation. I traveled with my daughter, son-in-law, and "almost" 2-year-old grand-daughter. Staff was friendly and helpful as were other guests. It's a very quiet resort, so a couple of evenings with noisy neighbors was a bit of a shock. However the 10pm "curfew" worked and we slept well. A one-bedroom ocean view was just the right size for us and the few hundred foot walk to the beach was easy even with a toddler. The big pool (there were 2) was lovely. We hope to return. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: AmaranthineLove
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feeling... Our family stayed at this location as they did frequently when visiting the island. There had never been any problems until our last trip. The pull out bed was disgusting and had bloodstains on the sheets so we asked for a new room in the morning. We were moved to a new room without much hassle however the pull out bed in the second room must have had an infestation of bed bugs. At night I thought I felt things crawling but could never catch anything in the light. The next morning I woke up with more than 20 bites on one leg alone. I hope they've taken care of the problem since then. The gazebo has wonderful food, and waking up to birds and plumeria trees outside the window is a plus. I'm still very hesitant to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Made reservations but didn't stay”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADDICT722
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was not what you would consider as luxurious the grounds were well kept and pretty. However, we were informed that none of the rooms had any AC. Although they tell you that there is a strong crosswind, Hawaii in August is still hot. We were fortunate to find a room at another hotel. I must say that Outriggers' reservation center were very helpful in this matter and we were able to reach a mutual agreement.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, away from the big hotels, well-maintained, and by-the-ocean condo”
Reviews.Author: Janet-with-kids
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Maui with my 11 yr old girl and 9 yr old boy. I am so happy I chose this place. It is small (100 units) and right on top of the ocean. There are a number of reasons why this place was so awesome.... 1. The beaches were not crowded and were clean. We were only steps away from the beach and with our ocean view room we could go to sleep hearing the waves and wake up to hearing the waves. 2. It's a little off the beaten path which is appealing to me. The downside to this is that we would have to drive a bit more to get to the main destinations, but what the heck if the condo is so good. 3. For those of you with kids, they have shuffleboard, croquet, and a huge checkerboard set (the coconut shells are the checkers pieces). We never turned on the tv once (i assume there was one in the room). 4. I wanted to stay in a condo so that I would be able to contain some of the costs of going to Maui by having a good chunk of our meals at the condo or having a decent setup so that I could make lunches to take with us. all the amenities were in the condo - just had to buy the food! 5. There are a few showers to wash the sand off so as to minimize the sand going into the condo. 6. The grounds with the koi pond and beautiful vegetation made it so restful. 7. They provided the kids with an activities bag and me with a pineapple which I thought was pretty cool. The biggest downsides: parking was sometimes not avaiable right by the condo and there isn't any A/C. For us, being from Phoenix, it wasn't an issue, but this could be a concern for some people. I would definitely return to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value if you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room”
Reviews.Author: Sgtgolson
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights at the Napali Shores in July 2009. We were initially let down by the accomodations after spotting a few cockroaches within minutes of arriving, considering we had just spent 4 nights in Oahu at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, however we took it in stride as it is Maui and bugs are to be expected. The hotel staff contracts with a pest control service and it must be a constant battle to keep the facilities free of bugs. Our favorite part about this location was the beach, as we were able to actually swim with the sea turtles just off of the beach as they come to feed on the reef in the early evening. We enjoyed our stay, however it was a bit noisy each morning as other guests walked past our room to go to the beach, pool or to eat. We were able to avoid the long line at the Gazeebo restaurant by ordering breakfast as "take out". The Gazeebo restaurant is on the room phone's speed-dial and I was able to pick up their awesome breakfast in as little as 10 minutes. If you do want to eat at the Gazeebo, I recommend getting the food to go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Aloha33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8 nights for our honeymoon in October. We were looking for something affordable, but right by the water/beach, relaxed and away from the crowds. We found just what we wanted at Napili Shores. We booked unit 201 in building A, which is Ocean Front - as close to the water as you can probably get anywhere, and closest to the beach path. I think that building A and second floor would have to be the best location in Napili Shores. We booked through the owner through their website found in an internet search. The unit had been remodeled and had a very modern feel to it - I loved the decorations, not your typical beach stuff. We had everything we needed for the kitchen and bathroom and for trips to the beach. Shower was small and the bathroom tended to get hot/stuffy, but the rest of the condo was kept cool with the breeze so long as windows open. It's a studio with a king bed, perfect for our honeymoon. Building A does not get traffic in front of it, but being on the second floor made it completely private. We fell asleep and woke up to the sound of the waves and the blue ocean was the first thing we saw when we woke up. The grounds were very nice and added added to the charm of the stay. The front pool felt cool, the heated pool in garden area felt better, but we spent all of our time at the beach and exploring the island. We watched most of our sunsets from Napili Bay, and it was one of our favorite places to be on the island! The Gazebo restaurant was great, (loved their pancakes - half stack is more than enough) and the staff has breakfast down pat. There was always a line, but it went fast. I think we ate there 3 times! There is a Maui Taco up the street that we also enjoyed. Check in was easy. We had little interaction with staff other than that. When you rent direct from owner there is no maid service, but that was fine for us. We had free high speed internet. We would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pretty Place To Be”
Reviews.Author: JoBos
Reviews.Content: Be aware that if you are fussy about solitude and privacy, this is probably not the best place for you to stay. I had a garden view room that, though the view was very pretty, it wasn't particularly private. Even on the second floor, drapes have to be drawn any time you don't want someone to be able to see in, either from the pool area or from the balconies across the way. Also, the rooms are very open and airy and, thus, sound travels well. It's fairly easy to hear conversations outside or in the next room. Having said all that, this is a great place to stay. As I said, we had a garden view room but others in our party stayed in an ocean view room, meaning they could step out on their balcony and look down to see the waves crashing on the rocks below. Just beautiful. There's a full kitchen, a room safe and free internet access. No air-conditioning but, as stated, the rooms are vented and airy and the ceiling fans work well to circulate the air. I highly recommend breakfast at the Gazebo Restaurant. The food is excellent, as is the service and the scenery. Just note that it's a very popular spot and folks start lining up at 7AM or earlier for the 7:30 opening. The food and service at the Maui Grill are also great but they have no liquor license so BYOB. Overall, if I ever get back to Maui, this is one hotel I'd definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: venkman62
Reviews.Content: My in-laws wanted to take the entire family on a trip to celebrate their 50th. Since our family had been to Napili Shores 4 times I suggested here. As usual, Napili Shores did not dissapoint. We had a group of 10, including 2 teenagers in 3 condos. The BBQ area was great with nice new. clean stainless steel grills. The pools and surrounding grounds were very clean and well kept. We will be back but not soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: AgieLu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a garden studio and overall thought the resort was fine especially for the price. Its located on a very nice beach with good snorkeling on both sides. The exterior of the resort is pretty dated but the rooms are comfortable. The laundry facility is very nice and there are plenty of machines, front desk sells detergent. The koi pond is very nice and Gazebo restaurant is good and decently priced. Internet is not wireless which was a downside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Condo - Very Quiet”
Reviews.Author: borad
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice quiet condo complex on the northwest side of Maui - supposedly the leeward or downwind side of the island. Let me start with the pro's. The location is very quiet and secluded. While there are other condo's adjacent to the complex, all are only 2 or 3 stories tall and Napili Beach really feels like your own private beach - away from the masses that visit Kaanapali. The exterior of the condo is unimpressive when you pull up in the car. In fact you might even begin to have second thoughts but I have to tell you the rooms are very nice for the money. Well appointed, large, and clean. We didn't use the pool area (I'll get to that in a second) but we took advantage of the BBQ's which were in spectacular working order and clean - in fact they looked almost brand new. The property is a like a sleepy condo away from the noise - a perfect spot if you're looking to get away and really perfect for older couples or families with children. Cons: While the location was on the leeward side it was very windy. We asked a few locals about it because I've been up a Kapalua a couple of times and not experienced so much wind. They informed us that it's often windy in that area. So windy in fact that if you lay in the sand you'll get a free sandblasting. Same thing happened to us in Kaanapali so I'm guessing that perhaps we were there on a particularly windy week. We got around it by driving down to Waliea each day....the weather was AWESOME down there. No wind at all and we realized that when Napili is cloudy it's often crystal clear in Wailea. Almost every day when driving back from Wailea you'd be in the sun until you got past Kanaapali...then you'd hit the wind and clouds. Again, maybe we were just unlucky? Something you may want to think about. A second downside (which isn't a big deal for us but may be for you) is there are no nearby restaurants. We did walk up to Merriams on our last night - a new restaurant in Kapalua which was really nice but other than that you're left to traveling in to Lahaina town. Oh, and on that note, traffic on the West side has increased significantly since I was in Maui last; just another thing to keep in mind. If you cook your own food this isn't a problem. But another word of caution. Take the time to use the Safeway in Lahaina and avoid the local markets - including the Star Market. They are VERY expensive. Safeway is at least tolerable. As far as the property itself goes, overall I'd give it a "C". The rooms are really nice and clean but the property is a bit dated and the grounds, while well kept, are very simple as is the pool areas which because of the wind we didn't use. The beach looks fantastic and we even saw the famed Sea Turtles. Snorkeling looks to be great, but again we spent all our time in Wailea due to the winds. Overall I think this is a good property for older couples or families with children but if you're looking for a little action this is probably a "pass" for you. Good value for the money, good "private like" beach area (if you get lucky with the weather), but a bit dated, and maybe too low key for some.

Reviews.Title: “Quite area north of the island”
Reviews.Author: Caro07
Reviews.Content: For those who are allergic to skyscrapers by the sea, this is the place. The resort is composed of 2-story buildings centered around a pool or facing the ocean. We had a garden view studio with a large and private balcony. We enjoyed having breakfast there with the smell of trees in bloom. The flowers were at arms reach. The full kitchen was very usefull as the breakfast was quite expensive. We would stop at a nearby grocery store on our way back to the hotel at night to enjoy dinner on the balcony too. There are a few gaz BBQ you can use at no charge near the pool area. Avoid the free ''welcome breakfast'', it's a tourist trap. We left after 5 minutes, just couldn't stand the sales pitch. The grounds were impeccable and maintained daily. The central pool is very warm and it is great to go for a swim and stare at the stars after a long day sightseeing. The resort has it's own beach, which may be a bit exposed compared to nearby bays. There were however see turtles in the breakers off the point. My best recommendation would be to jump in the car and drive to nearby Honolua bay. It is a rocky beach that you'll reach after a 5 minute walk in the forest, not suitable for children to play or to sunbathe but the snorkeling is exceptionnal. Go there early, tour boats start dropping their passengers in the water around 1030h and it can get crowded. Yes people actually pay to snorkel there. You'll be glad you drove 5minutes early in the morning and had the place to yourself and your new turtle friends (just don't touch them their protected). The bay is home to a large array of fishes and we found the turtles on the right hand side of the bay about half-way out to sea. The previous beach on highway 30 is more suited to family fun, it is nice and sandy and accessible by a long set of stairs. There was some rip current (nothing major but keep an eye on small kids). The best part! All beaches are free and public. Just park on the side of the road and walk. The late check out is worth it if you are leaving on an evening flight, as most beaches are ''wild'' I didn't see much showers to freshen up before getting on the plane. This hotel is a little north of most points of interest, but the extra drive is worth it to avoid crowds and tourists. You can almost feel like a local. Would go back again. Oh yes, you'll want to sleep with the shutters open to get a nice breeze going through the night, just don't be surprised to wake up very early every day, the birds are quite vocal and the trees just an arms length away! For those who golf, there is a world class golf course just a few miles north of the hotel. At about 130$ a night with the airline employee rate, this place is excellent value for money. Especially considering unlimited internet access and how impeccable everything is. Oh yes, one small disappointment. We had to fax some important documents internationnaly while at the hotel, I believe the charge would have been of about $35US for a 4 page fax (ok you're supposed to be on vacation but things do happen). There is a post office in a nearby strip mall who can do it for a quarter of the price, just ask the front desk, they'll direct you to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Deenie65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napili shores and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, had a stocked kitchen, and had a great location. There are two pools that we enjoyed very much. You have to walk a short distance to Napili bay but not a big deal. The beach was amazing. You could hear the ocean at night and all of the birds. The staff was friendly. They even offered to mail postcards to our friends and family. It is a short distance from Kapalua Beach which is one of the best snorkeling in the world. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Crowded at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: surfcity6
Reviews.Content: I had previously read a review concerning the serving line at the Gazebo restaturant prior to my arrival. I kind of wrote it off thinking that it was no big thing. After being a guest at this Outrigger fresort, I too experienced the same feeling of having non-guests mill around the condominium pool facilities queing up to eat in the former poolside snack bar. I sympathize with the author of that informative review. It was an annoying distraction from what was a good vacation. I think the rooms were a little understated and the furnishings including the bed were very uncomfortable.. The staff was attentive as usual. I looked at like properties in Napili and have filed them away as a possible rental next year. I want to have a beach environment in front of my rental unit, not 200 yards to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GHP57
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii. The Napili Shores was recommended by a friend and we found the facility great. We stayed in an ocean view studio on the 2nd floor and our unit was great. Very clean and comfortable. The grounds were exceptionally well kept and the front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The beach was just a short walk (5 minutes) to the right and 5 minutes to the left was a cove full of sea turtles that may for great snorkeling. The only issue at this resort was the Gazebo resturant was right at the ocean side pool and people waiting in line (at least 20 -30 each day we were there) take over the pool deck. Management gives no consideration to the people staying at the resort. The solution is so simple....have the people line up going up th 3 stairs to the central court yard instead of all over the pool deck. With the expense of going to Hawaii and all the options available this one issue for us is enough to find another place to stay next time. Too bad the place is great and this issue is so simple to fix if anyone in management cared to......

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: marissarox100
Reviews.Content: personaly i wouldnt recommend going there i didnt enjoy it, i went there the end of december to new years and it rained everysingle day we had one day of pure hot sun. but it was windy. the rooms are nice, you get a dvd player so bring your dvds for the night! because at night there nothing to do at all! if your staying at napili shores remember to rent a car! it takes aleast 15 minutes to go to a grocery store. there arent that many restaurants the top restaurants are... some steak houses which arent that good. there is a subway, pizza hut, mcdonalds, and the best meal we had was at costco which was about 20 minutes away. the beach was okay alittle small rocky in some places. i didnt get to try the scooba diving. i wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: NojPerth
Reviews.Content: We selected Napili Shores because it was good value for money in an area of Maui in which we wanted to stay. Previous reviews had mentioned great snorkelling at the nearby beaches with plenty of turtles etc and this was the clincher for us (and proved to be true). To be honest first impressions upon arrival were not fantastic as it seemed a lot older than expected and a little dated. However this feeling did not last and as soon as we had settled into our studio apartment we began to relax and soak up the charm. The interior of the apartment was fairly modern with stone bench tops etc. The staff were very helpful and always seemed willing to help in providing advice during our stay. We ended up booking a couple of trips through the resident expedia staff member who was also very helpful and we would definitely recommend attending her presentation on your first day there - she offered good advice whether booking trips or not. We also really liked the horseshoe lay out of the place and in general there seemed to be a very social and friendly vibe, whether it was longer term time share owners or first timers such as ourselves. The central pool/spa seemed to be a bit of a hub for this. The Gazebo Restaurant seemed to be very popular for residents and visitors alike and the only thing I could attribute this to is it's ocean views. We didn't eat there but the menu looked average and the coffee looked horrid. However for coffee fans there was one of the best coffee shops we have had in the USA in the near by Napili Shopping Plaza (can't remember the name but it was in the same complex as the Taco Shop, Boss Frog Snorkel hire etc). It offered well made espresso coffee and a wide range of tasty treats. If you've got a hire car the location is fine - we were only a ten minute drive to Lahaina (where we ate most of the time) and most of the rest of the island was fairly accessible. Based on our short itinerary I think we would have been driving heaps no matter where we stayed. Given the great local conveniences such as the local beach, nearby coffee shop, friendly vibe and proximity to Lahaina, I would highly recommend Napili Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: BMW902
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days with our 4 year old daughter in August. That was the second year we stayed at Napili Shores, because of the location right at the beach and the playing area for children in the middle of the horseshoe built property. Our daughter made many friends during our stay. We had a one bedroom apartment with partial ocean view, with a Lanai, which was perfect. Beautiful kept lawn, the pools are not too crowded. The front desk staff very helpful, great Hawaiian hospitlity. Kudos keep up the wonderful place in Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: omaWestVancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful property BUT the management is not interested in looking after their quests. There is a restaurant on site called the Gazebo and every morning as a paying guest you are woken up to the arrival of cars parking outside your unit and people loudly talking on their way to the restaurant. At no other hotel we have ever stayed at do they allow people the freedom to park anywhere and quests to have to fight for parking with diners. The restaurant is located at the pool and the diners will sit on the pool furniture as a line-up develps and again, we, as the guests either have to try to find seats or have this long line-up snake around the pool and have people stare at us as they talk loudly on their cell phones as we are trying for peace for our holiday. They do nothing to control the parking and often we come back to the hotel to find no parking since it is taken up by diners or residents of the neighbouring hotels and people going to the beach. Also, they seem to like to do repairs during the Xmas holidays to further inconvenience their guests. This gives you the added joy of work noise starting before 7am!!! Management seems not interested and the place is expensive for the lack of attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Blew us away!”
Reviews.Author: gretchenenders
Reviews.Content: If you're anything like me, you find booking a hotel sight-unseen a scary process. But let me try and alleviate any fears, The Outrigger Napili Shores is GREAT! Our second floor ocean-front studio (room #275) was beyond anything I could have possibly hoped for, I get goosebumps thinking about how it felt to walk in for the first time. The kitchen was stocked with all the cooking essentials and I really wish we would have taken more advantage of staying in to cook. The bathroom was huge, the bed was comfortable. And then there's the view. Oh that view. I could have spent day after day on our lanai, just meditating on the sound of the ocean, wishing the sunsets would never end, watching early morning paddle-boarders and people traversing the tide pools. There is a small strip of grass leading down to the rocky tide pools (divided by a chain link fence, but didn't at all detract from the view), which were so much fun to explore. I much preferred our location to the properties to the north. Because we weren't directly on the beach (only a 2 minute walk away), it was much quieter and the traffic wasn't nearly as busy. Plus The Gazebo Restaurant is right there on-site. The line moves quickly and is well worth any wait. We ate there three times in our five day stay. Yuuuuum. I'd recommend highly The Outrigger Napili Shores and will definitely stay there on our next trip to Maui!! Thankyou thankyou for such a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ostatejon
Reviews.Content: We got a first floor room with a partial ocean view. The interior was very nicely updated with full-size appliances and a full stock of kitchen utensils. The only thing that detracts from the appearance of this property is the outsides of the buildings look dated, but they are certainly not run down. Pros: Snorkelling off of beach (just to the right of hotel and shared with other properties). Swam with a sea turtle! Very nice barbecue grills (4 on property cleaned daily by staff or use the provided brush if you don't get there first). Hot tub and heated pool (unfortunately the heated pool and hot tub are on the opposite end of the property from the ocean). I did not swim in the pool near the ocean, but I believe it is not heated. Provided beach/pool towels on check-in (soft and neutral brown). Cons: Most things are a bit of a drive. About 15 minutes to Lahaina (Front Street area). 50-60 minutes to OGG airport. 35 to 45 minutes to main tourist harbour. Notes: There are grocery stores nearby, but they are pricey. May be better to shop in Kahului on your way from airport (expecially if you are a COSTCO member). If you fly into the main airport (OGG) don't be tempted to take the apparently shorter road around the north-west end of the island. It's shorter distance-wise, but is single lane in many locations and will probably take around 2 hours versus around 50-60 minutes heading south and then back north along the west side of the island. The north-west drive is a nice sunrise drive if you have the time and your passengers aren't prone to motion sickness. There is a nice blowhole and a quaint small town along the north route. Gazebo restaurant is great, but only open until 2PM. You can walk to a restaurant at another hotel down the beach, but we didn't try. No evening bar on property. No air conditioning in room. Second floor rooms have higher ceilings (better air circulation(?)) and more private patios. Quiet hours 10PM to 8AM.

Reviews.Title: “A Long Time Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetical
Reviews.Content: We've been comimg here nearly every year for over a decade, but this is the first tme we've written a review. We've brought family and friends and came alone. The units are delightful. They were totally refurbished in 2007. The studios are large, nearly 600 sq ft and the one-bedrooms are even larger. Completely equipped. Full kitchen. Flat screen TV. High-speed internet. Very friendly staff. Immaculately kept grounds. Napili Bay, which has good snorkeling is a 5 min walk away. Kaluha Bay, which has great snorkeling in a five minute drive away. We've always bought a NWA package. This year it included a $50 crocery certificate. Nice present. You can also book direct. Everybody we've brought here has loved it.

Reviews.Title: “What a cozy place!!”
Reviews.Author: rnrquest
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this small hotel in a garden front room. The plusses were the kitchen was fully stocked, the room was clean and updated, the grounds were lovely, parking was easy and free, Napili Beach with turtles, clean gas barbecues on the grounds, lanaii for every room, and the hotel's small quaint size. The not so great things were no A/C (was a little uncomfortable for a couple of nights, could be a problem in the middle of summer), the pool area could get loud during the afternoon, the key card didn't work all of the time, and the Napili Tavern had weak drinks. Altogether we think it was a good deal and we would stay there again. Would recommend to people who don't necessarily want the big resort scene.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: rmkahn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from 10 days in Maui, staying at the Outrigger Napili Shores. I have been coming to Napili Shores since 1986 and can not say enough good things about this place. The grounds are beautiful and it is situated on a gorgeous section of the Napili Bay coastline with access to a family friendly beach or Honokeana Cove, a sea turtle haven. The staff is always friendly and the rooms clean. There is the always busy Gazebo for terrific breakfast & lunch and a new place, Napili Tavern (they have taken over Fish & Poi). Napili Tavern's menu seemed a little lacking but our choices were quite delicious. Napili Tavern has only just taken over the restaurant, but I think as it matures it will do well.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a GREAT Maui location”
Reviews.Author: historybee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Outrigger Napili for 6 days in July for my brother's wedding. The resort has studio and one-bedroom rooms/suites, in either Ocean or Garden view. We found that location is *very* important, especially in the hot months. We first booked a Garden suite. The room was nice inside, but there were 2 problems: first, the room overlooked one of the pools, resulting in a lot of noise; and second, the room faced away from Napili Bay. That meant that the nice cool sea breeze couldn't come in, and the un-airconditioned room was too warm for us. We upgraded to a second-floor oceanview room, and what a difference! Apart from the stunning view, the room always got a nice cool breeze and was very comfortable. We were almost cold at night! In the cooler months, the lack of a/c probably isn't a problem, and it certainly was nice and quiet at night -- no humming, rattling ac units. But we felt it was DEFINITELY worthwhile to upgrade. We were in G building and didn't notice any noise from the restaurants as others have mentioned. Both restaurants were great, staff was generally friendly, and Napili Bay has got to be one of the more beautiful places on earth. And we loved the 10 pm quiet hour; it was so relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see the Turtles and very affordable for Maui!”
Reviews.Author: jami674
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days & 3 nights @ the Outrigger Napili Shores around Labor Day weekend 2007. I chose this hotel because I had read the beach waters in front were rich with Honu (The Hawaiian Green Sea Turtle). The first thing I noticed after we left the airport (OGG) was that this hotel was quite a long drive away. It is located a few miles north of the more popular & crowded resort area of Kaanapali Beach. When we pulled into the hotel it wasn't any fancy resort and the main restaurant seemed to be closed down. Once we were in our rooms though we were very happy. Our room was very large and had a full kitchen so we purchased some breakfast foods at a nearby market and ate in our room every morning. The room did not have AC but there was a nice breeze off the ocean and we never felt too hot. You can see a neighboring island (Lana'i I believe) from the hotel grounds and the sunset off the west shore was spectacular. There is a rocky beach directly in front of hotel, that if you can navigate across the rocks, has perfect snorkeling waters that are filled with Honu. About 50 yards to the right is a more traditional sandy beach shared with other neighboring hotels that is perfect to lounge, swim, and snorkel. Please enjoy the turtles here, but do not pet them or try to hold onto them. They are very large and you should do your best to stay clear of them as the waves come crashing in as their weight might knock you over! But they are amazing to watch & photograph. If that's your thing, I highly recommend this hotel. There is a small breakfast/lunch only restaurant near one of the pools but we did not eat there - it always seemed to have a crowd and I'd heard good things about it. This hotel was less expensive than many others, but still not the cheapest. We had a rental car and spent little time here but it was perfect for what we were looking for. I would say the main negative was that it was far away from everything kind of. It doesn't even really seem to be in Lahaina at all, although with most Hawaiian islands, things like this don't seem important. If you don't mind being away from the hustle & bustle of busier resort areas, I would definitely recommend. But you will need a rental car to see the rest of the island! The hotel staff was very nice and while I"ve stayed in fancier places in the islands, this was a great for the price (about $140/night).

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: holycowabunga
Reviews.Content: Only 2 nights but it was well work the power vacation concept. We thought it would be really far from everything but it is closer than you think. Studio condo was large enough for both of us with all the amenities we expected. Only drawback was no full tub. The front desk staff did a good job at check in and warned me about the line at the Gazzebo breakfast and to order take out. 2 pools on the long property. They have a bell to ring if you see whales. Check out was nice and the clerk asked how was everything and was sincere. Definitely worth a return visit to this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Can be noisey”
Reviews.Author: AdventureAdict
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Napili Shores twice. Both times, I have loved our garden view room, the pools, Fish and Poi restaurant, and awesome Gazebo dining. This is not a fancy location, but is in great proximity to beaches and not far from Kaanapali and lahaina. When we stayed this time, I noticed the area is struggling in the current. To keep the rooms full, Napili Shores is renting rooms to traveling construction workers. They fill the rooms with 4 or more workers -- probably to save money. The unfortunate part is that they start drinking when they get off work and hang out on the stairs. They go to bed early - 9 pm -- but wake up to head off to work around 5 am and are very noisey and creud. Surprisingly, this problem recurred 3 times. The "Irish guys" left and were replaced by two other equally rowdy crews. The foul language was unfortunate since we were traveling with our young children. Call me a prude, but it's not what I had hoped for during our annual family vacation. Be warned, if you see the concierge for help with booking activities, she will push attending a time share presentation. She made a dreadful recommendation for the Royal Lahaina Luau. I suspect it was because she gets the best cut for the referral. It was over crowded, the drinks were watered down, the food was reminicient of a high school cafeteria, and restrooms were filthy! I've seen many luaus and this was just sad. On a final high note, we saw lots of fish and turtles when snorkling. And the concierge did recommend a zodiak trip to see whales. They were phenominal!!! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in A or I Building - Oceanfront all the way.....”
Reviews.Author: Wetcoaster9
Reviews.Content: Stayed in A103 for two weeks this March. Would definitely recommend the A or I buildings since they are ocean front. The other buildings face each other and might have slight ocean views, but walking through the grounds, we could hear TVs, conversations, crying babies, children playing - it was all a bit noisy for us. Consider the A building the best because there is no beach access in front of it, so the only people using the small grassy area between the building and the rocks are the people staying in the building (12 units in this particular building) A 103 looks exactly like the pictures, has lots of storage, a very comfortable wall-bed, is decorated nicely and the bonus of an in-suite washer and dryer. This is not the unit for people who say all they do is use the room to sleep. This is for people who appreciate lovely, clean surroundings and attention to detail. Leave the sliding glass doors open and listen to the sound of the waves all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Value for MAUI”
Reviews.Author: davedmd
Reviews.Content: We found this one by owner. It's a great place for the value when your in Maui. The condo was remodeled with granite tops and plasma TV, overlooking the pool. This place has 2 restaurants and a bar. It's not a place for singles or swingers. More of a family oriented place also suitable for older people. Has 2 pools and a hot tub. It was built in the 70's so don't expect the facilities to be in new condition. Beach is nice and you must have a car here to get around. Air conditioning is not common here and may not be in your room. We found it was not necessary this time of year, but the dissadvantage of keeping the windows open is the noise from people walking outside or getting up early. I was also awakened by the next door neighbor one night who was snoring like an elephant. Over all we loved it and would stay here again if we came back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LilLover
Reviews.Content: HIGHLY reccomend this hotel! This was my 3rd visit to Maui and the best one yet! My fiance and I stumbled on Napili Bay on a previous trip and HAD to stay next to this beach for our next return. We had an ocean front room In Nov 07 that had vaulted ceilings, a kitchen fully stocked with everything you'll need, large bath w/ granite and romantic decor! It was awesome having the slider open at night to hear the waves! Their restaurant was always packed in the mornings. Locals love coming to breakfast because of the amazing views! We would order our food to go and eat it at the pool instead of waiting an hour like some people did :) Very close to the beach, a lil strip mall less than a mile away with a grocery store etc... We got engaged on Napili Bay and are planning our wedding there in Nov of 2009 and we have to have our guests stay here just so we can say "now you see what we mean" :) Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: jparet
Reviews.Content: This is a great property for families. It is quiet, safe, kid friendly, small, and clean. It is a great place to hang out. We loved the community barbecues.

Reviews.Title: “1 minute to beach, free high-speed & HD tvs”
Reviews.Author: vancouvermatty
Reviews.Content: We were here with our 5 month-old daughter for a week in December. We thought it might not be as nice as its website but we were wrong: the property was beautiful with lots of lawn space to play, the room was spacious and clean with a fully stocked kitchen, and Napili Bay was a stellar spot to play in the surf and snorkel. We will be back next year, but we will book an oceanview room to avoid parking lot noise from the gardenview rooms. Kate from the concierge was especially helpful. We enjoyed the high speed internet (ethernet cable provided) and HD tv, although they do not subscribe to HD content. There is also a supplied VGA cable so if you bring a laptop you can connect directly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: VS09
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel on a clean beach, clean room, friendly staff--- you do not need to think twice....just go ahead and book it !! I read reviews on this website and I am glad...thanks all for your great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to mega-high-rise bustle & cost”
Reviews.Author: Socal Flyer
Reviews.Content: Located about a 20-minute drive northwest of the town of Lahaina, Napili Shores is an excellent choice if you prefer something a little more laid-back than the fancy bustling high-rise resorts that are proliferating north of Lahaina. The Shores is an older condo development, very well kept up, that offers the most significant amenities without layers of extras, and at a more reasonable cost. We observed that it attracts a horde of repeat guests and that many of the condo owners themselves spend a good part of the year in residence. The units are a mix of one-bedroom and studios with balconies, arranged in two-story buildings that mostly face an immaculately maintained central courtyard (see picture). The buildings closest to the ocean are canted to provide ocean views. The courtyard has two pools and a Jacuzzi, plus a fish pond and very attractive landscaping. At the seaside end of the courtyard the beachfront is rocky, but a short connecting path leads to a nice sandy beach immediately adjacent. There is an ocean-front gazebo restaurant that serves breakfast & lunch (with a line forming each morning for 7:00AM breakfast!) and a full restaurant-bar at the street end that is open for lunch & dinner (see pictures). Food was quite good and prices reasonable by Hawaii standards. Other amenities include an on-site Expedia agent for booking activities and inexpensive ($1 per boarding) public bus service down to â€œhigh-rise rowâ€� and Lahaina town. There is a coin laundry and a small â€˜necessities shopâ€™. All rooms have phones with free local calling and modem jack, but only some units have broadband internet (apparently an option provided by some unit owners). Our two-week stay was very enjoyable, with only one sour note, a noise problem that causes us to downgrade the overall rating one notch. The units are not air-conditioned and must be kept open on both ends for the pleasant Hawaii breezes. Unfortunately, the rectangular box construction amplifies external noise, most annoyingly the nighttime parking lot comings & goings. Restaurant/bar patrons and condo guests subjected us to a chorus of chatter, banging car doors and beeping alarm-set horns that seemed to be right in the bedroom with us. Recommendation: Get a unit near the beach end and well away from the street-side restaurant area.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo...not for lovers of large hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: stevenson_mcintyre
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 14-18, 2007 for a wedding at nearby Kapalua Bay. Stayed in building B on the second floor in room 212. We had a great view of the ocean although not right on the water. This complex has different style rooms and we chose the one bedroom style which keeps the sleeping quarters separate from the rest of the condo. There are also studio style rooms which cost less and you can select what building you want to be in based on the property layout which is located on their website. Great for families since you have a full kitchen and fridge/stove/microwave and eating in Maui can be pricey. Go to the island orientation that the property offers. Eden is great giving suggestions for various helicopter tours etc. You need a car on the island but some of the tours pick you up right at the hotel. I would recommend the sunset dinner cruise and hike of the rain forest. The hike includes a pickup right in the hotel lobby. The only downside is that our bedroom was next to the parking lot and you can hear ppl coming and going and hear landscapers cutting trees.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: kmward
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Napili Shores 3 out of the last 4 years for our family vacation. Absolutely fabulous. We have children 10 and 4 now and I cant imagine a better place for them. 2006 we tried the Westin...what a mistake! Not only did the trip cost 3 times as much (mostly because they dont have a kitchen),but try 10 days and nights in a tiny room with 2 kids...no good. Stop at Costco after you get out of the airport, load up with stuff, and have a blast at the best beach on maui...not to mention one of the least crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Condo Resort”
Reviews.Author: saverguy
Reviews.Content: When we read on Trip Advisor that there was no air conditioning we hit the panic button, however, no mechanical device could ever replace, and no words could ever describe, the incredible tradewinds that cooled our beautiful condo. Upon arrival we learned that we were upgraded to a one bedroom from a studio. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and the lovely grounds. Would definitely return to Maui and this condo for a longer stay in the future. The Napili Shores is home to one of the best breakfast and lunch spots on Maui, The Gazebo. People start lining up at 7 am for the 7:30 opening. You can grab a poolside chair and sit down while you wait. It is a great meal with a great view and well worth waiting for. My only criticism is of the beach arrangements. It is shared with the hotel next door. There are no seating arrangements so unless you have your own beach chairs there is no real lounging except for the towels you have brought. However, the hotel has 2 nice sized lovely, clean swimming pools with a view of the ocean. Very, very nice for its price range. A true 3 star in the best sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: softiegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo here for our honeymoon in January 2007. Pros: - Condo was large, clean & really nice - The beach was really close (and we saw Turtles!) - The Gazebo made really yummy food (but long wait to get in) - Friendly Staff Cons: - Both pools looked nice, but were freezing cold the whole time! - Expensive - The spa was always too full - Not enough places to eat dinner in the area - The sea water had a lot of huge wild waves. Some people may like this, but we prefer more relaxed, calm water to swim in. Overall this was a nice place to stay. Next time we go to Maui we will probably stay somewhere else though.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to leave this place”
Reviews.Author: D_in_Washington
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, as did 20 friends attending our wedding. So we saw a half-dozen different rooms, both Outrigger-owned and privately owned and can speak to the pluses and minuses. No room has a bad view from what I could tell. Napili Shores is shaped like a long, narrow horseshoe, opening to the ocean. While units at the closed end of the horseshoe lack a direct ocean view, they look out onto golf-course quality lawns with plumeria trees, tall palms and hibiscus bushes. The complex is quiet, at least in late Feb.-early March. (I imagine during spring break -- mid-March -- there might be lots of kiddies with families.) There are about five barbecues on the grounds, half of them overlooking the ocean and pool -- a great meeting place for a large group. We pulled up chairs and had a grand time, watching the sunset. The Outrigger-owned units were renovated in early 2007, adding new furniture. They're now a little nicer than the privately owned ones, with flat-screen LCDs and new appliances. The downside is you can't request a specific unit from Outrigger beyond ocean/garden view as you can with privately owned condos.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Shores....the home of the Gazebo”
Reviews.Author: golfbug97
Reviews.Content: Another great Hawaii vacation at Napili Shores... 3rd time there and can't wait to return. H268 ocean view condo.

Reviews.Title: “Studios are not too small”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonApple
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I enjoyed our stay at Napili Shores. Pros: Oceanfront view, good snorkling beach next door, highly rated restaurant on property. Studio was plenty big for the two of us. Daily towel exchange of beach towels came in very handy. Grocery store less than a mile away. Cons: A bit warm at night, as these units do not come with air conditioning and the layout of the unit prevented us from having a good cross-breeze. Exterior of units need updating (inside of unit has been updated). Tip: If you book a reservation through Outrigger, continue to check rates afterwards--the rate for my studio went down $30/night, and I was able to obtain this lower rate even a few days before I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mark_SF
Reviews.Content: I knew nothing about this place when I hotwired a deal for one night prior to the start of a weeklong hotel package in Kaanapali. I agree with a previous post about the outside hallways and parking area looking a little rough around the edges, however all of that changes once you go inside your unit. We were pleased to find a recently remodeled one bedroom unit with comfortably casual furnishings and a full kitchenette. We stowed our food/drinks which had been purchased at Costco/K-mart in Kahului and headed out for a walk along the Napili Beach. In terms of relaxation and ambiance, I would put Napili ahead of Kaanapali. And the location next to Kapalua was ideal. Overall, the resort feels remniscient of the places I stayed with my family in the 70s - low slung, wood shake roof buildings scattered around lush grounds and basic, but nice, swimming pools. I would recommend this place if you're looking for a low key, relaxing and beautiful getaway with an eye for value. Head for Kaanapali or Wailea if you want big name resorts with the associated amenities and generally higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Outrigger Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday0107
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Away from tourist area. Away from resorts. great beach nearby. Very Clean. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from Lahaina and stay in Napili”
Reviews.Author: FGSR
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in mid-July. If you are looking for low key fun and maximum value this place is the place for you. The hotel is in the process of renovating but it seems to be one room at a time and the noise is not a factor. The front office staff is friendly enough and when we didn't like our first room they willingly switched us to a upper level room. Many families seem to get together here and there are alot of get-togethers between rooms for ground level units. We stayed in #267 with 3 people. View was good but if I had to do it again I would have sacraficed the privacy of a bedroom for the outstanding views from the Ocean Front Studios. Building A- seems to be the quitest. Resort has some rough edges with an unattractive board in the restaurant window and a trash area that could be concealed better. However, don't let the outside hallways turn you off as the landscaping on the courtyards is very nice. The bay to the South of the property is loaded with turtles and tropical fish. Load up on groceries and other stuff in Lahaina at the Safeway and enjoy evening sunsets that are fantastic right from the lawn at waters edge. The hotels web-site pictures are accurrate but notice they don't show you the front hallways- they are working on improving them however.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Napilia Shores”
Reviews.Author: CarrieAnnWalnutCA
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing negative to say regarding this hotel except one thing, NO A/C. Being from So Cal we are pretty used to A/C everywhere we go. I knew this going in, but there were a couple of nights where the humidity (too high) and the trade winds (too low) did make for a rather uncomfortable night's sleep. I can say they did have ceiling fans in every room, including the bathroom, which was really nice. This hotel was very clean and the staff and accommodations were excellent. There is a line by 7:00 every morning for breakfast at The Gazebo and I would give the place a B+. The dinner restaurant is probably a C. Go to Lahaina there are a lot of offerings there. I would check around before booking trips with the Concierge who is employed by Expedia. She is definitely convincing in what she wants to sell you. We booked a snorkeling trip through her with the Pacific Whale Foundation. I was told we would see hundreds of spinning dolphins only to be told once we got to our first stop that we would not be going there because of rough water. We went to another place to see the turtles, I didn't see any; we saw more wildlife from Napili Shores than anywhere and that is free and you can rent snorkeling equipment! She will also try to convince you to take a bus (tram) to Hana. No need, the drive is not bad. You have to be aware that only one car can pass through the many bridges at a time -- it's truly no big deal. Everything that we booked through her was a disappointment for the money spent. We book a sunset cruise through the Kapalua Kai catamaran company, that was GREAT. I think it's a must do for relaxing, enjoying drinks, pupu's and the beautiful Maui sunset. We did have a wonderful time and would book Napili Shores again, maybe when I go back they will have A/C....

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: TucsonDaug
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay for one night after our 3 nights in Hana. The reservation line got us a 1BRroom within 24 hours of our call at a pretty decent rate. Our unit was clean and fully remodelled. Office staff were cheerful, very friendly and helpful. Unit was clean, nicely and newly furnished. Beach is a few feet away. The only drawback was how sound carried through our one-bedroom unit. The noise level was exceptionally loud since we were surrounded by families with young children who began their day at 6:00 am. Their conversations we so amplified that we, as well as our teenagers, were turned off by their loud conversations both on the lanai and in the hallways. It sounded like they were yelling their conversations on our room. This is a great place for folks with young children and budget travellers, just be aware it can get noisy. Maybe if you request a quiet room you can avoid our problem. As for the Gazebo restaurant, yes the pancakes are great but the line for seating was extremely long. TIP: call down & get pancakes to go (you can easily share a stack with two people). We picked them up in 10 minutes and were finished before the line people moved a few feet. Yes, you might want to sit in the open-air restaurant, but this way you can make you own coffee and get to the beach.
