Also, ChinaBoat Restaurant is good, delivers and servings are large enough to split.

Reviews.Title: “Third time-a charmer!”
Reviews.Author: pilotWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at Napili Shores in the past 5 years and the quality has not wavered in those years. The ocean view studio room we have had each time has been delightful and reasonably priced. The staff has been helpful and though the maid service is listed for every third day, our maid stopped in each day to give us fresh towels and clean whatever we wished to have done. For those who feel a need to be in air-conditioning, these rooms are not so equipped. Actually, with the ceiling fan and the Trade winds, it isn't needed. We ate breakfast most days at the Gazebo restaurant on the grounds. The combo (banana, pineapple, Macadamia) pancakes are to die for!! Oh, and don't forget to drink POG. This is a great place to rest and relax. If you are looking for glitz, night-life, etc., this is not the place to go. If you are looking for friendly people and Hawaii at its best, Napili Shores is the place.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: adamandcelia
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Maui on our honeymoon and stayed at this Outrigger hotel. The rooms are large and have a kitchen, fridge etc. Only grumble I would have is that the room service comes once every 3 days and you have to request daily room service if needed (we didn't realise this until the last day!). The hotel itself has two pools (both fairly small) and has the fantastic location of being near the sandy beach inlet - it is all very scenic. The staff were friendly and polite. I think it was great value for money and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding visit”
Reviews.Author: ASwee
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip back to Napili Shores. What people need to understand about this place is that it's not a mega-resort. That's the total beauty of it. It's a more true Hawaiian experience - wtih its low rise, casual, but totally beautiful setting. No, there is no big expansive white sand beach with lifeguards. What you do have is one of the best bays on the island [IMO] with Napili Bay. Literally steps from your doorstep here - you can spend a full day on the beach enjoying some of the best waves, and most beautiful scenery there is. If you want upgrades and creature comforts - look around on the owner sites and rent directly from an owner. We have both times - and both units are upgraded to total comfort and style. The unit we are in right now is direct ocean front - totally redone - granite, limestone, surround sound, full plasma TV [should you choose to turn it on]. All the comforts of home wtih a full kitchen and a washer and dryer. It is possible to stay in total comfort - for roughly $200 a night if you do your homework. Our first stay was almost the exact same [sans washer and dryer] in a one bedroom here for around $165 a night. You simply need to look around on the vrbo listings and there are tons of options for this and the other Napili condos. We just left the Mauna Lani on the Big Island [stayed in a golf villa on the Fairways]. That place was total luxury. Guess what? My family prefers Napili Shores. We cook out on the outdoor grills and the girls are outside playing shuffle board. Wouldn't trade this experience, or this location for anywhere else on the island of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “solid value!”
Reviews.Author: nsbea
Reviews.Content: Having reviewed the resorts carefully, mostly on this site, we decided on the Outrigger Napili Shores. We were doing Maui-on-a -budget, and felt like this would be a good value. We also were looking for a more peaceful, less crowded location than the main resort area. We found it! Pulling up to the lobby, I was a bit concerned, as it is rather unimpressive. However, our room (gardenview studio) did not disappoint. "Posh and pampering" won't come to mind, but "pleasant and practical" will. The view by the ocean is even better than the higher end resorts , and the Napili Bay beach is very close. The Gazebo Restaurant was very good. The line starts forming around 7:00 am, for a 7:30 opening time. Sip the free coffee, watch the whales, and share tips and info with those in line with you! Keep in mind that Napili isn't super close to most activities/drives, etc. However, for what we wanted from this trip, Napili Shores and it's location was a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Beware”
Reviews.Author: raerob
Reviews.Content: Before booking our vaction we had the Travel Agent check on the smoking regulations. The policy at that time was no smoking in the rooms but smoking was alright if you were 20 feet from the rooms. This is a good policy and we were happy to comply. The problem is that in January 2007 after we had already booked the Condo Owners passed a change to this policy. Thier new policy is no smoking on the property. When checking in we again asked about smoking and were told that 20 feet from the rooms was OK. I am sorry to say that the Condo Owners have taken enforcement to a level that is ratter disappointing. Even though we smoked at thier assigned smoking area (Beside the garbage cans) there was constant harasment. To the point that on several occasions smokers were told to leave the site and smoke on the street by a Condo Owner. Needless to say these the Condo Owners should slow down let the Management Staff for Outrigger advise the guests on the Smoking Policy Change. There is no need for the Condo Owners to enforce changes, they are not trained in any sort of hospitality and end up being rude.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaLala
Reviews.Content: My first ever experience on the islands of Hawaii, we stood here. My husband and I have been to many different places, from Florida to Puerto Rico. This place was wonderful! The staff, service, cleanliness, room, etc.; Ever since, when we go to Maui (we have gone back of course!) I don't want to stay anywhere else. We have gone to other hotels on the island, just to check it out. Napili Shores is definately the place we want to stay that has all of what the other's offer. Less busy, noisy and more of the island appeal we were looking for. Like I said, we will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation, different location would be better”
Reviews.Author: DOTIAINEDINBURGH
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Outrigger where we stayed for 9 nights. Room 154 was excellent. View of the ocean but not directly in front of it. Arrived on a Monday night which wasn't so good as the restaurant is actually closed on a Monday. After a long flight, we just wanted a quick bite to eat and then bed. Nice to have your own kitchen area with large fridge/freezer, dishwasher and also a flat screen TV. Disappointed with the location. Napili is known as one of the cloudiest/wettest parts of the island and when you are travelling from Scotland in January, it's nice to have a bit of sunshine! Ate in the restaurant (Fish & Poi) on a couple of occasions. Food was to a good standard although the first time we ate there we received our main course while we were still eating the starter! Even though the guy noticed this, he just dumped them on the table and took off! We didn't have a hired car but eventually hired one for 2 days. Nearest restaurants at Napili Plaza are 15 minutes walk away and Lahaina is 15 minutes drive away. Most of the snorkelling trips/whale watching depart from other parts of the island and do not pick up from Napili which was why we hired the car. Also the trips are much cheaper booking in Lahaina than direct. The trip to Hana does pick up from the hotel and is worthwhile doing. Very knowledgeable guide who was born and bred in Maui - also very unusual as everybody else seems to be from every other part of the States. Would have preferred staying in Lahaina with plenty choices of restaurants and bars. Outrigger was a little too quiet for our liking. No atmosphere in the bar (it's tiny) and also closed on a Monday night! Would recommend for familiies and older people (lots of them). We are mid 40s (no kids) but like a bit of an atmosphere and good choice of restaurants. Saying that, we can't fault the rooms or the grounds which were immaculate. Didn't have a problem with the rooms being cleaned every 3 days. Most of these condos are privately owned therefore I imagine the owners wouldn't want interrupted daily. Just makes you more independent. One slight complaint is that when the maid did come (we had just finished our breakfast and had not done the dishes), she placed our dishes in the dishwasher and put it on for an hour! Bearing in mind there were only two of us - with two cereal bowls and two glasses, it was a tad wasteful! If you are staying at the Outrigger the staff are friendly and helpful. Would recommend car hire if you want a bit more variety. A taxi to Lahaina costs $30 one-way. The bus into Lahaina is hourly but they go off at 9pm. A taxi to Napili Plaza costs $10 one way and has three restaurants. We preferred the Outback Steakhouse. Roy's was a bit pretentious! Not the fault of the hotel - but more central for us next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTravelingFam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Outrigger Napili Shores and loved it. The room was newly remodeled and we were pleasantly suprised to find high-end touches like granite counter tops. The kitchenette was great - all new appliances and fully stocked with every kind of dish/ glassware/ container you could need (we even had margarita glasses!) We also had a great balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean, and a high vaulted ceiling. We had our 8 month old with us and were glad to see that the hotel was very family friendly. All in all, we were really glad we had chosen the OUtrigger Napili instead of one of the larger, high-rise hotels, and we would definitely stay again if we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Scottish-Tourists
Reviews.Content: Wow - every bit of this trip was amazing! It was so relaxing and laid back, despite the fact that we never actually stood still for 2 minutes, there was so much to do and see and we only had 6 days to do it in. Rather than sit around the pool and "chill out" we had a go at most things including driving the road to Hana; driving up to the top of the mountain (10k+feet); snokelling with the turtles; surfing lessons (you can't not have a go); sunset cruise. I could go on............in summary - not to be missed if you ever get the opportunity. The accomodation was first class, we paid a wee bit more to get an ocean front view and it was well worth it - it was amazing to watch, see and hear the waves crashing in all the time. We got a one bedroom apartment - which had a king size bed, and which had 2 single beds in the living room - plenty of room for 2 adults & 2 children. The location was great, all facilities in the apt that you might want/need while on holiday if you want to do self catering. The restaurant in the hotel was really good, as were lots of others in the vicinity. A wander round to the next bay to go swimming with the turtles is a must - rent some snokelling gear from Snorkel Bob's along the road from the hotel - the hotel reception will give you directions. It was incredible. You can go on lots of (expensive) organised trips by boat to also go snorkelling with the variety of wildlife that is around the island, however this was incredible and just off the shore, and you can stay for as long as you want. Another recommendation was to buy a CD of the road trip to Hana rather than go on a formal trip. This allowed you to spend more time where it interested you and skip quickly by the area that weren't quite as interesting for you. It really gives very good information about the area and tells you when to switch it on and off as you pass by various landmarks - we would have missed a lot of really interesting things if we did not have it as a lot is off the main road and not in sight. If you do go on this trip one bit of warning remember you are in a tropical rain forrest, with lots of mossies and other nasty biting insects if you walk in the trees - take the repellant with you if you. The views along this road are amazing - well worth the trip. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary Place!”
Reviews.Author: Trojan-Wife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying in Napili Bay each year for our wedding anniversary. It's where we go to get away from it all. We have snorkelled all over Maui and Lanai but the best is right in Napili! Our typical day would be to drive to Lahaina for breakfast at Moose's (so big you take half back for the next day) then back to the condo to snorkel for 1-2 hours. Take a dip in the pool then lay a chaise on the grass overlooking the ocean......read or snooze. We rent directly from the owner and save about 40%. Everything is provided, from napkins to seasonings and we usually BBQ most nights we stay here. Awesome BBQ area and you meet some great people from all over. There are terrific restaurants close by too.. There can be noise here; sometimes babies & toddlers; just bring ear plugs. We have found that for the value we can stay twice as long and that makes Napili Shores worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Soup for snorkelers”
Reviews.Author: Daisy Larchmont
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a seven-night stay in an ocean-view one bedroom (B209). Very good value for the $$. We used to live down the road in Kahana, and I would often go snorkeling in Honokeana Cove (to the left of the Outrigger) to see the green sea turtles who hang out there. On this trip I wanted my kids (ages 8 & 11) to enjoy this unique Maui experience, since they were too young to do so when we lived there. Our first morning we went down to the cove, and within 30 seconds we were in snorkel heaven. They later joked that the cove was like "Turtle Soup." If you want to snorkel with turtles and see lots of marine life up close, the Napili Outrigger puts you within a few hundred yards of the best snorkel spot on Maui. Believe me, no boat trip can ever beat it (I've been on them all), so save your money for other pleasures. We paid $190/night, booked directly with Outrigger. Check-in was fast -- got our towels, key cards, and headed to our room. The upstairs units are best, as the high ceilings really help keep the place cool, plus you don't have anyone creaking around above you or walking right past your lanai. Two daybeds in the living room for our 2 kids, a seperate bedroom in the back towards the parking lot, sparse but quaint island decor, and ceiling fans (no AC). Fully-loaded kitchen with new toaster, coffeemaker, dishwasher, refrigerator, all the utensils and dishes/glasses you need, includiing BBQ stuff. All very clean. Big shower, hairdryer provided. Plan to make use of the broom in the closet as you'll be tracking in sand, and regular maid service is only every 3rd day (if you want it every day just call and it's no extra charge). I brought ear plugs as I am sensitive to noise, turned out to be a good idea due to proximity of parking lot to master bedroom. Car alarms, the bane of modern existence, would go off at night - not the hotel's fault. People in general were very considerate of the quiet hours, we found -- but if there's a baby in the next room, or you're unlucky enough to lodge next to the "Loud Family from Hell" (there's always one in every hotel) you're going to hear it. Definitely try Fish & Poi one night, or for lunch - it's reasonably priced, and the food is very fresh and very good. They have a daily happy hour from 4-5pm with reduced-price drinks and pupus. The Gazebo is still as good as I remember, not worth waiting in line for every morning, though. Try the Coffee Store in Napili Marketplace up the road (they have very good quiche, smoothies, and gourmet pastries). Another must-try is the Honokowai Okazuya / Deli down the lower H (lower Honoapiilani Road) in Honokowai - the Lemon Caper Mahi Mahi is fabulous. But the best bet is the Outrigger's own Turtle Soup, it's on the house...

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: mauijunkie
Reviews.Content: After staying 5 nights at the Westin Hotel and Spa, Outrigger Napili Shores was a wonderful change from the hustle and bustle that is Ka'anapali. This was our third trip to Maui and our first time at Napili Shores. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The unit we had was dated but it is an older property. We were not disappointed at all. The unit was nicely stocked with dishes, utensils and appliances. We had a garden view. It was far from the ocean but probably quieter because of that fact. The Gazebo was great for breakfast. The line is long first thing in the morning bust seems to lighten up as is gets later. Great sunset views from the pool area. We stayed 5 nights for 155/pn with a AAA discount. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from June 5th to June 11th. The grounds were clean, well maintained and very pretty. We were both suprised to say the least . Yes the rooms don't have A/C, but your not supposed to be in your rooms all day right? At night the heat was bearable with the ceiling fan. The sound problems at night that the other guest's had , we did not experience. The quick walk to the beach was nice. If you must eat the pancakes do get there early, around 7am. The line will start to form at that time. The gazebo is way over priced like all the food you will notice, 7.69 for 2 pancakes is a little much. The employees were friendly and very helpful. It was cool to see a gecko just about everytime i went to the office. I would much rather stay here than a highrise hotel. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from May 25th to June 3rd. I requested a 2nd floor room but upon arrival, the only room available was on the 1st floor. We were moved two days later. Several rooms are under construction (all furniture removed, painting, etc.) Quiet hours are from 10pm until 8am. However, we tried to have dinner one evening at the resort but several young girls decided that they wanted to sing in the courtyard. It does have a nice echo but think bad american idol. When this happened on a 2nd early evening (7pm to 9pm) I called management and they said they could only do something about this after 10pm. It was Memorial Day weekend and there were a lot of families with children. We stayed in buildings B and G. The children chased each other, climbed some small trees, played in the yard in front of other people's rooms, and knocked over a lamp post. This was all tolerated because it did not occur during quiet hours. A family of mostly adults decided 7am was the best time to have breakfast on their lanai and were very loud. Expect noise and crying babies. It is not a resort to sleep past 7am and not a romantic place to have a quiet dinner with your husband. Or perhaps we just had an unlucky week from the sound of other reviews. We did notice at 2pm it was very quiet. The rooms were clean and well stocked with the kitchen essentials; however, the pans were not non-stick. You need to buy all the basics (cooking spray, paper products, aluminum foil, seasonings, etc.) It was not as convenient as we expected. We only needed to use these items once or twice for the week. It was warm without air conditioning. We both have bad allergies and found it very difficult without AC. It would also have been nice to block the noise from outside. You can not seal your room because there is a screen next to the sliding doors that has wooden slats that you can close but does not block out the noise. If you do try to seal your room as much as possible, then you are hot and humid. It was a huge drawback for us. I think it might have been cool from 1 am to 4 am. The Gazebo closed for 3 days for repairs/cleaning. We stood in line at 7am for a 7:30am opening. There were 5 people in front of us at 7am but they were just the ones holding the spot in line for the rest of their families. By 7:30, there were 12 people in front of us. But luckily, with only 14 tables and we only needed a table for 2, we were the 2nd to last group to be seated for the 1st seating. It was a good meal but not worth the trouble and aggravation. However, the Fish and Poi restaurant was excellent. We ordered take out and it was worth it. The rooms were clean and most of the staff members friendly. Other guests were not as friendly as we find in the Caribbean. Also, there is no outdoor bar. I should have realized this before but every resort in the Caribbean has at least one bar staffed during the day and early evening. It would have been nice to have a Mai Tai to watch the sunset. We had to buy alcohol and make drinks ourselves. If you are going to Maui to visit beaches, stay in South Maui. The beaches there are long, flat, uncrowded, and the weather is warmer. A waiter at Tommy Bahama's told us that South Maui is the desert and West Maui is green and lush. It did rain most mornings in Napili. The Gazebo provides large umbrellas for guests waiting in the rain. Napili beach is OK but not the best Maui has to offer. The cove to the left of the Napili Point resort had the best snorkeling and the most turtles we saw. The Road to Hana was a good trip to see the different waterfalls. We were exhausted by the end and drove all the way around. The road is bumpy and unpaved and you cannot drive more than 10 mph for over 30 miles. So it takes a long time. A park ranger at Ohe'o Gulch told us that the driving time would be the same if we turned around and went back or kept going. We are glad that we drove all the way around because the scenery was worth the trip. We started the day at 8:30 am and it took until nearly 7pm to get back to the beginning and then another hour to get back to West Maui. For $200/night, Napili Shores was an okay place to stay. I wish I booked the Outrigger at Wailea. We liked South Maui and the rooms there have AC. It would have been worth the extra money to us but the reviews led me to believe that West Maui would have the peace and quiet that we were looking for in our Maui vacation. Maui Revealed was a necessity but I bought it after I booked Napili Shores. We used this book constantly and saw a lot of other people carrying it around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family getaway”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl74
Reviews.Content: We loved our week at Napili Shores! Best things about the property are the proximity to Napili Bay (great for swimming and boogie-boarding), the quiet (despite lots of kids being onsite -- including our own :) --, it was VERY quiet in the evenings, which we loved), the grounds (lush and beautiful), and the 2 onsite restaurants (the macadamia nut pancakes at the Gazebo are well worth the long lines). I liked being away from the hustle and bustle of Kaanipali -- it would have driven me crazy to be there all week. We picked a garden-view 1-bedroom (#241) and were pleased by the size of the unit and kitchen amenities (blender, dishwasher, spatulas, etc.). Despite there being no AC, we were fine with just the fans on and the lanai doors open. Also, the other people staying at the property were all very nice and we chatted with a number of the other families. I liked that the property was so multi-generational, with everyone from the very young to the very old hanging out by the pools. All in all, it was the perfect choice for our little family.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger was fun”
Reviews.Author: Back96ws6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Outrigger Napili Shores from May 17-22 2006. We had a good time. The room was very clean and nice, the resort is just to the left of Napili Bay (as you look out towards the ocean). Food: The gazebo restaurant is nice for lunch and breakfast with a good view. The banana macadamia nut pancakes were definitely good, however from all the rave reviews I expected more. I had the same pancakes in Kihei at a little diner in a strip mall (can't remember the name) that were just as good. There is a line every morning. So if you don't feel like waiting in line, walk up the beach to the North. At the other end of the bay is another resort with a nice restaurant which is also on the beach, and not crowded. Breakfast was reasonable ($8-10 each roughly) considering it's a resort. There is also Maui Tacos and Napili Market in the Napili Plaza, which come in handy being so close by. Maui Tacos is like a Roberto's Mexican Food. They have pictures of many famous people on the walls that have visited the place, so that was cool to see. We also ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina for the view (food wasn't bad either, just not a huge selection as you can guess by the name), as well as Subway (trying to stay on a budget). We ate out at Hula Grill in the Whaler's Village in Kaanapali one night. It was expensive but the view was spectacular and the food and mixed drinks (banana mac) were very good. You can see some pics of the sunset in the attached photos. Activities: We didn't do any tours, we just went to various beaches and snorkeled. Napili Bay was ok, however a couple days the waves were a little rough and it made the visibility bad for snorkling. However it most likely was like this in other beaches facing the same direction. We had the best snorkling experience in Wailea Beach. It's a public beach in between expensive resorts (the Four Seasons being one of them). Get there early or on a weekday to get a parking spot, otherwise you're out of luck. At the south end of the beach are some rocks. It looks like nothing is there. However a boat or 2 offshore from them should be your first clue. As you get out there past the rocks, there's quite a bit of coral and fish. We didn't get a chance to try Kapalua Bay (next time!). We did do the road to Hana, we went early to avoid the traffic. It worked. It's a nice ride, however bring your mosquito repellant if you want to get out and hike up around some of the waterfalls! I also got bit a couple of times sitting outside our room at the resort, which was a bummer, we couldn't really eat outside our room like we wanted to (another excuse to go eat out at the beach restaurant though ;). Once you've done the road to Hana, you don't really need to do it again. It's a long drive, and there's nothing really there! I had more fun snorkling =). Shopping: Favorite shopping was in Lahaina. Whaler's Village in Kaanapali is nice but a little expensive. Lahaina Cannery Mall is a small mall with some interesting shops, as well as a food court with greek, chinese, etc food. Flight: We took Aloha Airlines, straight flight from San Diego. It was great, no complaints. Overall: Positive experience at Outrigger, the staff were nice, I would recommend this hotel. I will probably not stay here again, only because I want to try Kaanapali this time (it was always sunny there it seemed) or Kihei, someplace closer to the great snorkling we found in Wailea. It is nice and uncrowded here though, as you can see from the attached pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: FLAMESFAN68
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the Napili area of Maui is a great place to stay on the island. The Outrigger Shores is only a 15 minute drive to Lahaina and walking distance to many other resorts and shops. Our unit was very clean and spacious (I highly recommend the one bedroom unit over a studio & get the 2nd floor). The one drawback we found was no air conditioning. Unfortunately, the trade winds were not blowing most of our 12 days, so it was very hot. Even with the fans at full speed & with all the windows open, it was still uncomfortable for sleeping. Having your windows open means you deal with car alarms going off, luggage being wheeled across the parking lot (the rooms back on the parking lot), talking and cat fights! We didn't get one decent night sleep the whole time. Bring your earplugs and expect to be uncomfortable sleeping! That was our only complaint. The units themselves are equipped with everything you need and the grounds are spectacular. We never had a problem getting a bbq & ate dinner on our lanai every night. The two pools are very clean and the ocean pool is very quiet (kids seem to use the other pool more, so it's noisy). Have breakfast at the Gazebo at least once! The line ups start at 7:00 and continue right until it closes at 2:00 (after lunch). You can rest fresh towels daily, otherwise, the rooms are cleaned every third day, which we found was sufficient. We walked to the corner store often, to buy fresh fruit & other groceries. The mall also has many other facilities, including snorkel/boogie board rental. The resort faces lava rock, but the beach is just off to the right of the resort & it's beautiful. We never had a problem getting a spot on the sand & there was great snorkeling as well! I think the resort is good value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Budzhockey
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a blissful 10 day stay at the Napili Shores resort. The resort is a collection of nine two storey condominium unit buildings situated in a quiet oceanfront section of the community of Napili. There are two pools, two whirlpools, a koi pond and numerous gardens and palm trees throughout the grounds. There is a beachfront restaurant, the Gazebo, which serves lunch and a restaurant in the front complex building of the resort, the Fish and Poi, which serves dinner and lunch. The Gazebo is known for its Macademia nut pancakes and there are line-ups for breakfast beginning at 7:30 am. The resort has access to the crescent shape beach around Napili Bay. The beach is clean and composed of golden sand while the bay offers calm waters due to the presence of a coral reef. The coral reef offers terrific snorkeling opportunities. I went on snorkeling trips to Molokini, Lanai and Napili Bay and found the variety and frequency of ocean and reef life greater in Napili Bay. Snorkel Bob's, a snorkel gear shop located down the road from the Napili Shores resort, rents snorkel gear on a daily or weekly basis. Daily rentals range from $ 5 - 9.00. The resort offers a daily beach towel service, a condo cleaning service every third day and has an on site laundry. There are also 5 gas barbeques where you can grill your dinner or lunch. The resort's clientele is composed of older couples or young families primarily drawn from the U.S. West Coast. The atmosphere is quiet, laid back and quite friendly. I enjoyed my stay at the Shores and hope that I can return again. If you're looking for a piece of tropical paradise and want value for the money, this is the resort for you. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “loved napili shores”
Reviews.Author: KAL717
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a week long stay at Napili Shores.....Like everyone else, we did a loooot of research but with the help of a travel agent and all the reviews here, we decided on Napili Shores. This truly is a beautiful property, the grounds are immaculate, yes the rooms are a bit dated and the beds could be better but everything else was so perfect that those were minor in comparison. Pros: -Full Kitchen and grocery stores within a couple minute drive (kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, blender, dishwasher, dishes, silverware, and cooking utensils) -Quiet private, safe property -Amazing Beach ( I feel that its not mentiond too much here but the beach is beautiful, private, easy access, great for swimming and great sunsets) -Can see the ocean from most rooms, even garden view -It is in a more private area away from the high rises and 5 stars but they are within a 10-15 min drive if you want to eat, shop or drink there -Free Parking!!! -Two pools, one jacuzzi, great gas grills Cons -Beds are a little hard, but they are manageable -outdated decor -we could hear people/kids from our room but wasnt too disturbing If you are looking for a romantic, private, beautiful, affordable getaway, Napili Shores is fabulous..there are about 5 hotels along Neapili beach that are all condos/low rise. You will not find spring breakers looking to party here, it is more geared towards couples and families. I recommend this hotel highly and will definitely be back! PS Dont Forget to sign the guest book in your room

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyK
Reviews.Content: The facility was well maintained and the staff helpful. There are about eight 2 story buildings in a "U" configuration. The rooms are exactly like the Candid Pictures.Oddly, our room (A104) had a piano. The kitchens have everything you need to prepare a meal and, since we don't believe Hawaii is noted for it's culinary art, we ate breakfast and most dinners in, enjoying the view and the sounds of the surf. There are 2 sets of very well maintained gas grills near the oceanside pool and the pool at the other end of thecomplex. Our rooms did not have A/C; the cool winds -and they really blow- are more than satisfactory to keep you comfortable. We stayed in 2 rooms: G156 and A104. Building G had an Ocean View. We decided we wanted an Ocean Front room (buildlings A & I) and enjoyed being 50' front the crashing surf. It's a very short walk to the pool, seaside cafe, and the beach at Napili Bay. We saw a whale from the cafe! It's a great place for kids and there are kids of all ages. Parking is secure and ample. We had an excellent dinner at the restaurant, Fish & Poi; better than Roy's at 2/3 the price. Personally, I prefer smaller, intimate hotels like this than the high rises where you have to walk forever just to get to the pool, beach, or the car

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price for Maui”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Napili Shores. We love the location and the condo gives us flexibility to enjoy our time in Maui. The rooms are clean and maid service was excellent. The room is cleaned every third day. However, if you want it cleaned more often, all you need to do is request it. We always have a hard time leaving the Napili Shores. We'll go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Resort on the Beach at a Reasonable Price!”
Reviews.Author: KiminColorado
Reviews.Content: Napili Shores is a quiet condo resort at the west end of Maui. After driving all over Maui I prefer the area of Napili/Kapalua the best and I am very glad we stayed here. Napili Shores has a great beach (Napili Bay. The condo has two swimming pools, one up by the ocean and one at the front of the resort. There are several barbeque grills on site, two restaurants and a 24 hour front desk staff. Pools are on the small side, but hey you have a beach why lay at the pool right? There is a laundry room on site $1.25 for a wash and $1.25 for a dry. The washers do come in handy if you are staying a long time because your clothes do get kind of damp and musty smelling after awhile. There is an on site concierge to help you book activities and things around the island, although you can do this yourself, it is not always necessary to use the concierge. Stamp machine onsite for mailing those postcards, however, a 23 cent stamp will cost you nearly double as the hotel charges there own "fee", which I think should be illegal. Free pool towels, the front desk will give these to you as you check in. However, you do have to return them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views, great time!!”
Reviews.Author: mammabear
Reviews.Content: Mt husband, myself and 2 boys were at the Outrigger Napili Shores for 1 week in march. We really loved it here! The condo was a perfect size for us (my boys are 12 & 10, but big boys) The boys slept in the living room which had 2 daybeds/couches. They said they were very comfy and slept really well. My huband and I had the bedroom, it seemed to be a king size bed, but advertized as Queen. The bed was comfortable. We had an oceanview, I loved the location of our room and would strongly request that building for next year. The Gazebo restraunt was awesome for breakfast, we ate there 4 times! The beach acces path is so easy to get too, in 2 minutes we were on the beach. We BBQ'd 3 of the nights we were there and really enjoyed eating dinner on our Lanai. The BBQ's were extremely clean. The grounds were very well kept, the pool (upper pool) was heated, but I prefer it a little warmer. But it was nice and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. The only complaint my husband and I had was house keeping. They only come every 3rd day unlees you request everyday, which we did, hey Im on vacation! We had a couple of really clean days, and some just so-so. If we would of had a vacuum or mop in our room, I wouldnt have minded, but when you are at the beach eveyday and running in and out of the condo the floors need some help. Its been said before, this isnt a 4 or 5 star resort, but it is an awesome location, clean comfortable rooms and nice grounds. It definetly felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible beds, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Velocity_Tours
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel is in a wonderful location but given that we spent $180 a night I expected much more. The bed was not even a bed rather a matress on wheels you pull out from the wall. The mattress was so uncomfortable (you and companion sink to the middle)that I ened up on the floor. The beach is great, grounds beautiful just the room was more like what I would expect at a motel 6.....not the Outrigger in Hawaii. I give them a terrible rating because I contacted them about this after the trip and they never even had the courtesy to reply. Maui is busy, so I guess where there is a demand people will pay top dollar even for a crappy room......It sure beat being home in the snow....would I go again yes. Would I stay at the outrigger....NEVER not after this experience. I reccommend staying in Kihei or Hana(just take your food with you to Hana). Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Noisy at the Shores”
Reviews.Author: chandygirl
Reviews.Content: we were pleased with the location of the hotel and our room was dated but clean. We were disappointed with the location of our room we were in #236.We heard the road construction, parking lot activities and all the visitors coming and going to and from the hotel restaurant. Lets just say we didn't get much sleep.Request a room near the water and you will be fine. They were unable and unwilling to move us do to full capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: as985
Reviews.Content: We spent our week (12/30-1/6) on Maui in an oceanview condo at Napili Shores. I would highly recommend unit G-155; not only is the view from the lanai beautiful, but the condo was very clean, well decorated, and had a fully stocked kitchen. The Napili Shores has very nice grounds; there is a huge lawn and lots of plumeria trees and tropical foliage. There are also 2 pools (1 oceanfront) and a jacuzzi. There are BBQ facilities scattered around the property, with nice gas grills. And don't forget to eat at the Gazebo restaurant which is located next to the oceanfront pool- excellent breakfast (if you are starving and don't want to wait in line you can call in your order, pick it up, and then eat on your lanai). One of the best features of the Napili Shores is its proximity to the gorgeous beach of Napili Bay. A very short walk down a paved path leads you to the white sand and warm turquoise water. I love the Napili area; this was our second trip to Maui, and I don't think we would stay anywhere else. On Napili Bay there are no high-rise resorts- it has more of the feel of what I imagine old Hawaii was like. And we loved the price; per night we paid a fraction of what the big resorts in Kaanapali and Wailea charge. Maui is a beautiful paradise and I can't wait to visit again. And when we do I would not hesitate to stay at the Napili Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: konagirl
Reviews.Content: The Napili Shores is a wonderful place for a family vacation. My parents and I spent 4 wonderful nights here in a 1BR oceanview. The resort is not luxurious but IS beautiful and quite well maintained. I would recommend it to families with children -- I also think the oceanfront studios would be great for couples. It's quiet, peaceful, and right next to a great beach. Great value for Hawaii, too. I'd definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: scropp
Reviews.Content: After hours of searching reviews, we decided to let the Napili Shores host our first visit to Maui. The location is quiet and convenient, easy to find. We enjoyed a second floor ocean view studio unit, which was equipped with a full kitchen. With a market located at the turnoff of the main road (1/4 mile from the resort) we enjoyed home cooked meals nearly every nite, saving a bundle for other activities. The kitchen WAS fully equipped with pots 'n pans, full set of dishes, glasses and coffee cups for like 6 or 8 people, all cooking utensils, can openers, and they even supplied clean kitchen towels and paper towels. A clean microwave and four burner stove/oven and a full sized fridge (with ice maker) made things so convenient. We stayed in unit 213. Our lanai had a clear view of Molokai across the channel. The sitting/viewing area to sit and watch surf (turtles and whales too!) was kept clean and had plenty of chairs. There are several barbeques at each of the two pools, which were cleaned every morning by the attentive staff (no lie, I sat and watched them do so while sipping my kona every morning!). At the lower pool you will find the Gazebo Restaurant, and surprisingly when locals asked us where we were staying, they would immediately recognize the resort as the location of the Gazebo! Great pancakes! One thing to note, unless you ask, there is maid service only every 3rd day. When we realized it though, we asked for towel service daily and they were happy to accomodate. Plumaria trees decorate the grounds, as well as other lush vegitation, all kept up daily by the gardening staff. In short, we're planning our next visit for next December, may take our kids next time. We loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 10 nights in Hawaii, 2 spent at the Outrigger Napili Shores. We had an oceanfront room (175) and loved the location to the pool and the beach, also the best thing was our patio which was about 30 feet away from the shore and had an awesome view (we're talking postcard paradise). I was a little worried about booking a hotel without A/C, but it wasn't a concern. The fan and the breeze kept the place a very pleasant temperature. The only warning I would give about the Oceanfront Studio room is that the waves crashing on the beach at night are very loud. If you are a light sleeper like me, you may want to opt for a Gardenview room instead, or at least bring your earplugs. Even the second night my wife complained about the sound and she's a heavy sleeper, but the view and the patio were worth it. Definitely a nice little place to stay, very close to everything. There was a kitchen in our unit (there is in all I believe) so that was really nice to keep snacks and have breakfast on the patio overlooking the ocean. The price was awesome, you won't get oceanfront for the price of the Outrigger anywhere else in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Napili Bay”
Reviews.Author: Maddy2246
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Napili Shores has beautiful grounds and awesome views of the ocean and other islands. I was somewhat nervous about booking this hotel because the people I talked to that had been to Maui told me I should stay in Kaanapali. I was so glad that I booked a hotel in Napili Bay. Very pleasant and low key atmosphere to come back to after exploring the island. The only issue we had was that for 2 full days of our 5 day stay, the maintenance crew was power sanding/grinding the tile of the upper pool which our room overlooked. When we asked to be moved the only room they said was available was only one building away so we didn't bother. I would recommend walking over to the Napili Kai Seahouse restaurant for breakfast. They said that they also had entertainment at night but we never got back to hear it. It was right on the sand and gives you a different view of the bay. The Gazebo was also terrific and we loved watching the sea turtles in the waves.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui 11 times and have always stayed at Napili Shores. Haven't considered staying anyplace else! If you are looking for a high-rise luxury hotel in the hub of the action, this is not the place for you. If you'd like the intimate feel of "true Hawaii", come here! Where do I start? The staff at the front desk is friendly. There is a laundry room (coin operated machines) down below the lobby. They also have a nice restaurant adjacent to the lobby, but we haven't eaten there. The oceanfront Gazebo restaurant serves delicious breakfasts and lunches. Their macadamia nut pancakes are a must! The line that forms there each morning is a good indication of how good their food is. (The line moves fairly fast -- just bring a cup of coffee to sip on as you enjoy a poolside and oceanfront view.) The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. There is a giant checker-board and shuffle board. There are two pools; one in the garden area (with a jacuzzi) and one oceanfront (next to The Gazebo). There are well-kept BBQS and picnic tables near both pools. The units we've stayed in have always been neat, clean and accommodating. Both studio units and the one-bedroom units have fully equipped kitchens. There is a good-sized grocery store in the Napili Plaza only a couple of miles away. Keep in mind that the garden units' bedroom windows face out toward the two (side) parking lots, so it can be a little noisy if people are coming and going before you arise. The two oceanfront buildings are studio units, only. Building "A" is rated A1 with it's view of the ocean AND beautiful Napili Bay. Speaking of Napili Bay -- this is another reason we stay here time after time! It is a short walk out the side gate and down a palm-tree lined sidewalk to the beach. The crescent beach is the perfect place for just about any beach activity...whether you want to just plunk down in the sand under a palm tree, go boogie boarding or body surfing, float on an air mattress in the 'softer' waves (toward Napili Kai Beach Club), or snorkel. You may never want to leave the 'neighborhood' -- but if you do, DEFINITELY save a day or two to stay right here! Napili Shores has a rocky shorefront with gorgeous sunsets over Molokai. It is perfect for kids (of any age) to go exploring in the morning during low tide. Off to the right of this rocky shoreline is the pure white sand of Napili Bay. If you walk around to the left side, you will find Honokeana Cove, which is a wonderful little snorkeling spot. The coral heads are beautiful and the tropical fish AND sea turtles are plentiful! The only drawback is getting in and out of the bay, which can be tricky. We call Napili Shores our 'home away from home' and would go back there in a heartbeat! It's far enough away from the touristy areas of Kaanapali and Lahaina, yet close enough to make the short drive to their restaurants, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: EnglandKelb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon. We were impressed with the cleanliness and even though the studios were nothing fancy they were well equiped. Th lack of a/c was a problem, but it was nice to have your own lanai striaght out to the BBQ and pool area. There are two pools and the bootom one overlooks the ocean and it's great to sit here and watch the sunset and watching turtles bobbing in the water. We enjoyed the outdoor gas BBQ's as it gave us a chance to meet other people, and we enjoyed the happy hour in the bar! Our main problem was that it is a few miles away from the main restaurants and bars. While we enjoyed the tranqulility of this area we did spend a lot more money to get taxis to the lively area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: VanBC_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights this month with my mom. We booked our room through Travelocity[...] for a good rate. Upon arrival, the front desk could not find our reservation, but they immediately upgraded us to a 1 bedroom garden (from a studio garden), so we were happy. The room was spotless, and had everything that we needed. No air conditioning, but with the ocean brezzes and ceiling fans, it was fine. The 2nd night, they gave us another option of upgrading to a 1 bedroom ocean view, which we glady accepted. The staff is very nice and so friendly which gave a warm first impression os Maui! We never ate at the Gazebo restaurant but it was always full and I know it is highly recommended. We had a full kitchen so it was nice to buy groceries and eat breakfast on the lanai. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained, with 2 pools, and all amenities were very nice. Napili Bay is adjacent and a 1 minute walk over some rocks to get to. If you are looking for an elaborate resort, this place is not for you. It's a smaller, cozier stay. I would definitely return. The only downside is that the 1 bedrooms have an open window (up high) facing the parking lot, which can be a bit noisy. Otherwise, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Unwind”
Reviews.Author: PeterV54301
Reviews.Content: Napili Shores was what I expected. A fairly quiet, serve yourself piece of paradise in heaven. At time the pool area can be loud, so if you want quiet, ask for a room away from the pools. Other then that, everything is spotless. The condo has everything you need to make yourself at home. The BBQ grills are plentiful, clean and great to use. It is also a nice place to meet new friends and share ideas for cooking. Seeing the turtles in the morning out in the bay was a great way to start off each day. While the maid service was every three days, that worked out very well. Full time around the clock security walked the hotel giving us a very safe feeling. This condo is not the Westin or the Marriott. You are about 5 miles for a grocery store and 8 miles to Lahaina, but that is one of the beauty parts. Very little if any crowds. What Napili Shores is is a very wonderful place to come home to each day with a great view, clean park like setting, your choice of two very nice pools and wonderful people. If that is what you are looking for, you will find it here.

Reviews.Title: “great beach location”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: Stayed in studio for one night. It was fine, although no bargain. However, the front desk staff were extremely nice. The resort is right on Napili Bay, which we loved. Calm, warm water, and the best snorkeling withouth going out far. The reef is easy to swim to, tons of fish, and enough sea turtles to make seeing at least one pretty likely. Having discovered this, we wanted to spend as much time as possible at the beach on the day of our checkout (and flight back to the mainland). Although late checkout wasn't availble, they provided a "hospitality room" for one hour in the early afternoon so that we could shower and pack our stuff. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Outrigger Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: sfa1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 07/18/05 - 07/21/05. This condo was just perfect for us. The grounds are beautiful. Even though their description says that it's not a "beach front" or at least in the Funjet travel brouchure....it is beach front. Directly in front on the condo is rocks that are in the ocean you can walk on, there is a walking gate connecting it to the beach. They do not have a/c. Our room was beach front and not having a/c wasn't a problem at all--even in July. The wind blows constantly. Being from Texas--I was very nervous about not having a/c. We will definatley stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “loved the smell of the plumeria trees”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napili Shores from a referral from a friend and also Trip Advisor. After reading the reviews, I felt that it was pretty much a sure bet that I'd like it. The one bedroom more than enough houses 3 people. Our room was upstairs which was perfect and left our glass sliding door open at night for the breeze. It's true that there is no a/c, but with the ceiling fan and the tropical breeze, and the length of time you'll be there, I felt you don't really need it. The grounds are absolutely beautiful, and always kept clean. I noticed that the people who stayed at the Napili Shores, (other people who were also on vacation) were very friendly and polite. People left their towels outside, etc. on their lanai, and that it was just a really nice place there and safe. Barbeques are a real plus and never a problem to get a barbeque. The view from the grounds to the ocean is breathtaking! One night we had a visitor, it was a gecko! I didn't know quite what to do. So, I just left the little guy alone, and went to sleep. Nature and all, you just gotta love it. It is pretty quiet there, and not much to do, but for the price in comparison to other hotels, you can save your money at the Napili, love it there and spend it somewhere else. The beach was actually right down some stairs. We went swimming the morning we were leaving at 6:30 in the morning. It was different than what we're used to. I'd definitely stay here again, it was absolutely beautiful, with the smell of the plumeria trees all around. Other people whom I spoke with at the Napili mentioned that this was their 7th time and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Hearing that, I know that I made the right decision.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveling Tina
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Napili Shores twice now. The first time, we splurged and stayed in an ocean view room, which was great! This time, though, we opted for a garden view room. The first room we were in was right by the pool, and therefore noisy at times (room 244). (It also had zero view of anything except the pool.) We asked to be moved, and were moved to room 252. The great thing about room 252 is that it is still at a garden view rate, but you can see the ocean in the distance. Also room 252 has DVD/VCR and CD players which was great for our family of 4 to entertain ourselves with rented movies. 252 is upstairs; 152 is downstairs. They are the perfect rooms to pay garden view rate and get an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Well rounded place - but not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As with most everything in life, there are tradeoffs and good&bad about everything. The Napili Shores is no different. My wife and I just returned from a week stay there for our first anniversary, having been married on the beach up the road at Kapalua (which was WAY out of our price range). With lots of good reviews about the Napili Shores, we made our reservations. The resort is tucked away in a nice area that is very much NOT upscale, overrun or busy. It's more of a community/suburb type area that just happens to have obscure resorts all along the oceanfront. The staff was friendly (though our dealings were exclusively checking in and checking out), and we really didn't notice them throughout our day. The grounds are maintained on a daily basis, pools were Always clear and clean appearing ~ the hot tub looked cloudy once (early morning, they may have just finished putting chemicals in). Room service is every 3 days, though you can request more often if you like. I felt that the kitchen appointments were fair to good, but I'm a cook and used to a well appointed kitchen so take this with a grain of salt. As you no doubt know, there is no AC in the rooms, just 1 ceiling fan. With the windows open over the front door, in the bathroom (same wall), and the window and door open on the lanai, there is often a good breeze ~ but it gets hot in the afternoons and 2 evenings it was Very uncomfortably warm. Note that I come from a home that never had AC or even ceiling fans and I currently live in the desert ~ I'm used to heat.... but the humidity made it just a little bit unpleasant. Thankfully a dip in the pool or a quick shower was enough to get comfortable again. I felt the bed was WELL above average in our unit (228). Some people have complained about the noise that drifts in from the lanai, and to be honest, I only ever heard birds (they actually woke us up at about 5:30am every morning). Kids were only a problem when their parents weren't being Parents and allowed them to create havoc ~ this wasn't often, but certainly kept us out of the pool on several occasions. We ate at the Gazebo one morning early on, and were disappointed (lots of high remarks here had our hopes up). I've easily made similar pancakes when in a rush and just whipping them up, and far better when taking my time. We skipped Fish and Poi (the restaurant/bar) in favor of other offerings on the island that we knew were high quality. Note that the VAST MAJORITY of rooms are garden view, a few are ocean view, and a handful are ocean front (there are ZERO beach-front rooms). Make absolutely certain you know what you're renting.... I spoke with a few folks staying that were disappointed with the view. There can be a large variance in $$ between the rooms too (ocean front was twice the amount as our garden view when we booked back in February). Napili beach is rather nice, not a 'premier' beach (visit Kapulua, less than a mile up the road, to get an idea of the difference), but nice. It was never crowded when we were there, but the water is sort of choppy and rough for beginner snorkelers. Actually, as far as snorkeling is concerned, I didn't much care for Napili itself... there was a fair amount of fish, but the coral was limited. On the other hand, follow the path that leads in front of the resort (ocean side), up in front of the condos next door and visit the next cove over, and there is a lot more coral and several sea turtles (a couple of them are Quite large). In short, it was a good place to stay, but the next time we return to Maui, we're looking for a Beachfront; hopefully couples only, place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 20 year anniversary trip. We stayed at unit A104, which is an ocean front studio. In a nutshell, the views were fantastic, the ocean breeze made up for the lack of A/C...and I'm VERY hot natured, the beach was very nice, we watched turtles in the surf 30 yds from our patio, the gazebo breakfast was very good (call in the order and take it back to your lanai if you want to save some time), the staff was friendly and responsive to our requests, the grounds were in great shape. I can't imagine staying here without planning for an ocean front unit...the difference in price(direct through the outrigger site) was nominal. If our travel plans take us to Maui again, I can assure you that Napili Shores unit a104 is what I'll be looking for! Both photos were taken from our lanai (patio) with a view of Moloka'i
